nodes.name: power-only generating unit
description: A power-only generating unit is a power generating unit that has only the function to produce electrical energy.

nodes.name: power generating unit
description: A power generating unit is an energy transformation unit that has the function to produce electrical energy.

nodes.name: liquid biofuel
description: A liquid biofuel is a biofuel that has liquid as its normal state of matter.

nodes.name: biofuel
description: A biofuel is a combustion fuel that has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: flow battery
description: A flow battery is a battery in which chemical energy is provided by two chemical components dissolved in liquids contained within the system and separated by a membrane. Ion exchange (accompanied by flow of electric current) occurs through the membrane while both liquids circulate in their own respective space.

nodes.name: battery
description: A battery is an energy storage object using different chemical or physical reactions to store energy.

nodes.name: onshore wind farm
description: An onshore wind farm is a wind farm that is build on land.

nodes.name: wind farm
description: A wind farm is a power plant that has wind energy converting units as parts.

nodes.name: report
description: A document assembled by an author for the purpose of providing information for the audience. A report is the output of a documenting process and has the objective to be consumed by a specific audience. Topic of the report is on something that has completed. A report is not a single figure. Examples of reports are journal article, patent application, grant progress report, case report (not patient record).
editor_note: 2009-03-16: work has been done on this term during during the OBI workshop winter 2009 and the current definition was considered acceptable for use in OBI. If there is a need to modify this definition please notify OBI.

disagreement about where reports go. alan: only some gene lists are reports. Is a report all the content of some document? The example of usage suggests that a report may be part of  some article. Term needs clarification

2009-03-16: comment from Darren Natale: I am slightly uneasy with the sentence "Topic of the report is on 
something that has completed."  Should it be restricted to those things 
that are completed?  For example, a progress report is (usually) about 
something that definitely has *not* been completed, or may include 
(only) projections.  I think the definition would not suffer if the 
whole sentence is deleted.

2009-03-16: this was report of results with definition: A report is a narrative object that is a formal statement of the results of an investigation, or of any matter on which definite information is required, made by some person or body instructed or required to do so.
2009-08-10 Alan Ruttenberg: Larry Hunter suggests that this be obsoleted and replaced by 'document'. Alan restored as there are OBI dependencies and this merits further discussion

nodes.name: document
description: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole

nodes.name: immaterial entity
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Immaterial entities are divided into two subgroups:boundaries and sites, which bound, or are demarcated in relation, to material entities, and which can thus change location, shape and size and as their material hosts move or change shape or size (for example: your nasal passage; the hold of a ship; the boundary of Wales (which moves with the rotation of the Earth) [38, 7, 10

nodes.name: independent continuant
description: A continuant that is a bearer of quality and realizable entity entities, in which other entities inhere and which itself cannot inhere in anything.
b is an independent continuant = Def. b is a continuant which is such that there is no c and no t such that b s-depends_on c at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [017-002])

nodes.name: grid supplied electric vehicle
description: A grid supplied electric vehicle is an electric vehicle that has a current collector to use electrical energy.

nodes.name: electric vehicle
description: An electric vehicle (abbreviated as EV) is a vehicle that uses one or more electric traction motors.

nodes.name: hydrogen power plant
description: A hydrogen power plant is a power plant that has hydrogen power units as parts.

nodes.name: power plant
description: A power plant is an energy transformation unit consisting of power generating units and a grid component that feeds electric energy into an electric grid.

nodes.name: liquefied natural gas vehicle
description: A liquefied natural gas vehicle is a gas vehicle that uses liquefied natural gas as fuel.

nodes.name: gas vehicle
description: A gas vehicle is an internal combustion vehicle that has only a gas engine as a motor for propulsion.

nodes.name: policy instrument
description: A policy instrument is a plan specification of an organisation (e.g. a government) that promotes transformative measures.

nodes.name: plan specification
description: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts, and that may be concretized as a realizable entity that, if realized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.
editor_note: 2022-01-16 Updated definition to that proposed by Clint Dowloand, IAO Issue 231.

2009-03-16: provenance: a term a plan was proposed for OBI (OBI_0000344) , edited by the PlanAndPlannedProcess branch. Original definition was " a plan is a specification of a process that is realized by an actor to achieve the objective specified as part of the plan". It has been subsequently moved to IAO where the objective for which the original term was defined was satisfied with the definitionof this, different, term.
2014-03-31: A plan specification can have other parts, such as conditional specifications.
Alternative previous definition: a plan is a set of instructions that specify how an objective should be achieved

nodes.name: software descriptor
description: A software descriptor is an information content entity that contains additional information about the software.

nodes.name: information content entity
description: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing.
editor_note:
information_content_entity 'is_encoded_in' some digital_entity in obi before split (040907). information_content_entity 'is_encoded_in' some physical_document in obi before split (040907).

Previous. An information content entity is a non-realizable information entity that 'is encoded in' some digital or physical entity.
2014-03-10: The use of "thing" is intended to be general enough to include universals and configurations (see https://groups.google.com/d/msg/information-ontology/GBxvYZCk1oc/-L6B5fSBBTQJ).

nodes.name: process boundary
description: p is a process boundary =Def. p is a temporal part of a process & p has no proper temporal parts. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [084-001])

nodes.name: occurrent
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: every occurrent that is not a temporal or spatiotemporal region is s-dependent on some independent continuant that is not a spatial region
Occurrent doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. An example would be the sum of a process and the process boundary of another process.

Simons uses different terminology for relations of occurrents to regions: Denote the spatio-temporal location of a given occurrent e by 'spn[e]' and call this region its span. We may say an occurrent is at its span, in any larger region, and covers any smaller region. Now suppose we have fixed a frame of reference so that we can speak not merely of spatio-temporal but also of spatial regions (places) and temporal regions (times). The spread of an occurrent, (relative to a frame of reference) is the space it exactly occupies, and its spell is likewise the time it exactly occupies. We write 'spr[e]' and `spl[e]' respectively for the spread and spell of e, omitting mention of the frame.

BFO 2 Reference: s-dependence obtains between every process and its participants in the sense that, as a matter of necessity, this process could not have existed unless these or those participants existed also. A process may have a succession of participants at different phases of its unfolding. Thus there may be different players on the field at different times during the course of a football game; but the process which is the entire game s-depends_on all of these players nonetheless. Some temporal parts of this process will s-depend_on on only some of the players.

nodes.name: power-to-methane process
description: A power-to-methane process is a power-to-gas process that has electrical energy as energy input, water and carbon dioxide as physical input and synthetic methane carrying chemical energy as physical output. It consists of two sub processes: an electrolysis process and a methanation.

nodes.name: power-to-gas process
description: A power-to-gas process is a power-to-fuel process that converts electrical energy to chemical energy by synthesising portions of matter into a gaseous synthetic fuel.

nodes.name: superconducting magnetic energy storage
description: A superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) is an energy storage object that stores electrical energy in the magnetic field of a superconducting magnet.

nodes.name: energy storage object
description: An energy storage object is an artificial object that has the function energy storage.

nodes.name: exajoule
description: An energy unit which is equal to 10^18 joules.

nodes.name: energy unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the work done by a certain force (gravitational, electric, magnetic, force of inertia, etc)." [NIST:NIST]

nodes.name: consumption
description: Consumption is the process of using something and thereby reducing its amount.

nodes.name: process
description: p is a process = Def. p is an occurrent that has temporal proper parts and for some time t, p s-depends_on some material entity at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [083-003])
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: The realm of occurrents is less pervasively marked by the presence of natural units than is the case in the realm of independent continuants. Thus there is here no counterpart of ‘object’. In BFO 1.0 ‘process’ served as such a counterpart. In BFO 2.0 ‘process’ is, rather, the occurrent counterpart of ‘material entity’. Those natural – as contrasted with engineered, which here means: deliberately executed – units which do exist in the realm of occurrents are typically either parasitic on the existence of natural units on the continuant side, or they are fiat in nature. Thus we can count lives; we can count football games; we can count chemical reactions performed in experiments or in chemical manufacturing. We cannot count the processes taking place, for instance, in an episode of insect mating behavior.Even where natural units are identifiable, for example cycles in a cyclical process such as the beating of a heart or an organism’s sleep/wake cycle, the processes in question form a sequence with no discontinuities (temporal gaps) of the sort that we find for instance where billiard balls or zebrafish or planets are separated by clear spatial gaps. Lives of organisms are process units, but they too unfold in a continuous series from other, prior processes such as fertilization, and they unfold in turn in continuous series of post-life processes such as post-mortem decay. Clear examples of boundaries of processes are almost always of the fiat sort (midnight, a time of death as declared in an operating theater or on a death certificate, the initiation of a state of war)

nodes.name: motor
description: A motor is an energy converting component that converts other forms of energy into kinetic energy.

nodes.name: energy converting component
description: An energy converting component is an artificial object that is usually a discrete part of an energy transformation unit with the function of transforming, transferring or changing a certain type of energy.

nodes.name: currency
description: A unit which is a measure of the medium of an exchange value, defined by reference to the geographical location of the monetary authorities responsible for it.

nodes.name: unit
description: "A unit of measurement is a standardized quantity of a physical quality." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: energy transformation
description: Energy transformation is a transformation in which one or more certain types of energy as input result in certain types of energy as output.

nodes.name: transformation
description: A transformation is a process that transforms one or more inputs into at least one output.

nodes.name: passenger train
description: A passenger train is a train that is used for passenger transport.

nodes.name: train
description: A train is a vehicle that uses railway tracks.

nodes.name: compressed gas engine
description: A compressed gas engine is a gas engine that uses a compressed gas fuel.

nodes.name: gas engine
description: A gas engine is an internal combustion engine that uses a gaseous combustion fuel.

nodes.name: direct marketer
description: A direct marketer is a trader who is the relay between the energy exchange and power plant operators.

nodes.name: trader
description: A trader is a market participant that engages in the transfer of financial assets in any financial market on behalf of a client or a financial services provider.

nodes.name: power line
description: A power line is a grid component link that is an uninterrupted transmission system between two nodes in an electricity grid.

nodes.name: grid component link
description: A grid component link is a grid component that serves as a connection between two other grid components.

nodes.name: framework factsheet
description: A framework factsheet is a factsheet that contains information about a software framework.

nodes.name: factsheet
description: A factsheet is a document that collects information about a specific topic in a structured way.

nodes.name: power-to-ammonia system
description: A power-to-ammonia system is a power-to-gas system that implements the power-to-ammonia process.

nodes.name: power-to-gas system
description: A power-to-gas system is a power-to-fuel system that implements a power-to-gas process. A water electrolyser is participating in the power-to-gas process.

nodes.name: time stamp
description: A time stamp is a zero-dimensional temporal region that is used to describe a time step.

nodes.name: scenario study
description: A scenario study is a study that investigates one or more scenarios.

nodes.name: study
description: A study is a project with the goal to methodologically investigate something.
editor_note: The construct 'has funding source' some ('has role' some funder) is necessary, because has funding source has the range has role some funder. This range comes from issue https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/ontology/issues/850 : funding source is some kind of independent continuant, i.e. a organisation or person, that does something special (giving money). So it is anything that has role some funder.

nodes.name: solar heat unit
description: A solar heat unit is a heat generating unit that has a solar collector.

nodes.name: heat generating unit
description: A heat generating unit is an energy transformation unit that has the function to produce thermal energy.

nodes.name: cargo ship
description: A cargo ship is a ship that is used for freight transport.

nodes.name: ship
description: A ship is a watercraft of significant size that is driving on the water surface.

nodes.name: model
description: A model is a continuant to represent a system and its behaviours in a simplified or idealised way.

nodes.name: continuant
description: An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Continuant entities are entities which can be sliced to yield parts only along the spatial dimension, yielding for example the parts of your table which we call its legs, its top, its nails. ‘My desk stretches from the window to the door. It has spatial parts, and can be sliced (in space) in two. With respect to time, however, a thing is a continuant.’ [60, p. 240

Continuant doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. For example, in an expansion involving bringing in some of Ceuster's other portions of reality, questions are raised as to whether universals are continuants

nodes.name: hydro energy transformation
description: Hydro energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts hydro energy.

nodes.name: time unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: carbon dioxide equivalent quantity
description: A carbon dioxide equivalent quantity is a greenhouse gas emission value that quantifies the combined effect of all emitted greenhouse gases by giving an equivalent amount of CO2 which would have the same effect on the climate.

nodes.name: greenhouse gas emission value
description: A greenhouse gas emission value is an emission value that quantifies the output of a greenhouse gas emission process.

nodes.name: sewage plant
description: A sewage plant is an artificial object that removes contaminants from wastewater to produce an effluent that is suitable for discharge to the surrounding environment or an intended reuse application.

nodes.name: artificial object
description: An artificial object is an object that was deliberately manufactured by humans to address a particular purpose.

nodes.name: combined heat and power plant
description: A combined heat and power plant (CHPP) is an energy transformation unit that consists of combined heat and power generating units, a grid component feeding electric energy into an electricity grid, and a grid component feeding thermal energy into a heating grid.

nodes.name: energy transformation unit
description: An energy transformation unit is an artificial object that transforms, changes or transfers a certain type of energy.

nodes.name: solar power plant
description: A solar power plant is a power plant that has solar power units as parts.

nodes.name: fossil steam reforming hydrogen
description: Fossil steam reforming hydrogen is hydrogen that is produced from a fossil combustion fuel in a steam reforming process which is not followed by a carbon capture and storage process.

nodes.name: hydrogen
description: Hydrogen is a portion of matter with the chemical formula H2. It has a gaseous normal state of matter. As it can be oxidised it can be used as a fuel.

nodes.name: import price
description: An import price is the monetary price for the import of a material entity.

nodes.name: monetary price
description: A monetary price is an economic value that describes the amount of money requested, expected, required or given in exchange for something else.

nodes.name: associated gas
description: Associated gas is a natural gas that is a byproduct from crude oil exploitation.

nodes.name: natural gas
description: Natural gas is a gas mixture occurring in underground deposits, whether liquefied or gaseous, and consisting mainly of methane.

nodes.name: lithium-ion battery
description: A lithium-ion battery is a battery that is rechargeable and in which lithium ions move from the negative electrode to the positive electrode during discharge, and back when charging. Li-ion batteries use an intercalated lithium compound as one electrode material.

nodes.name: process climate neutrality
description: Process climate neutrality is a process attribute that conforms to some climate neutrality criteria.

nodes.name: process attribute
description: A process attribute is a dependent occurrent that existentially depends on a process.

nodes.name: energy market model
description: An energy market model is a model that is about the energy market.

nodes.name: numerical computer model
description: A numerical computer model is a mathematical model that is calculated by a computer.
editor_note: formerly called "model"

nodes.name: explorative scenario
description: An explorative scenario is a scenario that contains certain constraints / statements regarding measures that are taken in the near future / today to explore where these measures will lead to in a later future. The later future is not predefined in the scenario.

nodes.name: scenario
description: A scenario is an information content entity that contains statements about a possible future development based on a coherent and internally consistent set of assumptions and their motivation.

nodes.name: marine hydro power technology
description: A marine hydro power technology is a hydro power technology that describes how to combine hydro power units, a hydroelectric energy transformation and oceans.

nodes.name: hydro power technology
description: A hydro power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: grid transferred thermal energy
description: Grid transferred thermal energy is thermal energy that is transferred via the grid-bound heating process.

nodes.name: thermal energy
description: Thermal energy is the energy that a material entity contains in the undirected motion of its constituent parts (e.g. molecules and atoms).

nodes.name: power-to-liquid system
description: A power-to-liquid system is a power-to-fuel system that implements a power-to-liquid process. A water electrolyser is participating in the power-to-liquid process.

nodes.name: power-to-fuel system
description: A power-to-fuel system is an energy transformation unit that implements a power-to-fuel process. A water electrolyser is participating in the power-to-fuel process.

nodes.name: ratio unit
description: "A dimensionless unit which denotes an amount or magnitude of one quantity relative to another." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: dimensionless unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of physical quantity consisting of only a numerical number without any units." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: EU allowance
description: An EU Allowance (EUA) is an emission certificate used in the European Union Emissions Trading System (EU ETS). It permits the emission of a CO2 equivalent quantity of 1 tonne.

nodes.name: emission certificate
description: An emission certificate is a licence that permits its holder/owner a specific emission value. An emission certificate can be traded at a CO2 market exchange.

nodes.name: fraction value
description: A fraction value is a quantity value that has a fraction as it's unit.

nodes.name: quantity value
description: A quantity value is an information content entity defined by a numeral together with a unit of measurement to quantify an entity.

nodes.name: count unit
description: "A dimensionless unit which denotes a simple count of things." [MGED:MGED]

nodes.name: installation guide
description: An installation guide is a documentation intended to help users install a Software.

nodes.name: offshore wind farm
description: An offshore wind farm is a wind farm that is build in a body of water, usually the ocean.

nodes.name: CO2 emission value
description: A CO2 emission value is greenhouse gas emission value that quantifies the output of a CO2 emission process.

nodes.name: emission value
description: An emission value is a process attribute that quantifies the output of an emission process. It can be calculated using the emission factor of that emission process.

nodes.name: cement
description: Cement is a portion of matter that is made from limestone and clay; other elements may be present. It is used as a building material to set as a solid mass or is used as an ingredient in making mortar or concrete. It has a solid normal state of matter. It is the physical output of an industrial process and has a commodity role.

nodes.name: portion of matter
description: A portion of matter is an aggregate of material entities that have a state of matter.
editor_note: Portions of matter describe mass nouns like e.g. water, air and fuel. Mass nouns are uncountable, but portions of these can be quantified, like 1 glass of water, 1 m³ of air or 1 barrel of fuel. For further explanation please refer to: https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/ontology/wiki/Explanation-on-mass-nouns

nodes.name: commodity role
description: A commodity role is a good role that inheres in something that is used in commerce and is exchangeable with other commodities of the same type.

nodes.name: good role
description: The role of an independent continuant or energy over which ownership rights can be established, whose ownership can be passed from one party to another by engaging in transactions, and that is not money.

nodes.name: compressed gas vehicle
description: A compressed gas vehicle is a gas vehicle that uses a compressed gas fuel.

nodes.name: ambient thermal energy transfer
description: Ambient thermal energy transfer is a heat transfer from the ambient air to a transportable material entity.

nodes.name: heat transfer
description: Heat transfer is an energy transfer of thermal energy.

nodes.name: climate scenario
description: A climate scenario is a scenario that describes a possible future state of a climate system.

nodes.name: synthetic fuel
description: A synthetic fuel is a fuel produced from one or more portion(s) of matter using electric energy.

nodes.name: efficiency value
description: An efficiency value is a quantity value stating the ratio between a process's inputs and the outputs that are used.

nodes.name: lignite
description: Lignite is coal that is non-agglomerating with a gross calorific value less than 17 435 kJ/kg (4 165 kcal/kg) and greater than 31 % volatile matter on a dry mineral matter free basis.

nodes.name: coal
description: Coal is a portion of matter consisting of combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock, formed as rock strata called coal seams.

nodes.name: wind rotor
description: A wind rotor (or wind turbine) is a turbine that converts the wind's kinetic energy into rotational energy.

nodes.name: turbine
description: A turbine is an energy converting component that converts energy from a moving fluid flow into rotational energy.

nodes.name: latent solid-fluid heat storage object
description: A latent solid-fluid heat storage object is a latent heat storage object that stores thermal energy by converting solid materials to their liquid equivalent i.e. melting the material.

nodes.name: latent heat storage object
description: A latent heat storage object (LHS) is a thermal energy storage object that stores thermal energy through phase transitions in phase-change materials (PCM).

nodes.name: annual GDP growth
description: Annual GDP growth is an economic value that quantifies the difference between GDP in one year compared to the previous year.

nodes.name: economic value
description: An economic value is a quantity value that is economically relevant.

nodes.name: nuclear power plant
description: A nuclear power plant is a power plant that has nuclear power units as parts.

nodes.name: time step
description: A time step is a one-dimensional temporal region that has a start time and an ending time and thus a finite duration.

nodes.name: one-dimensional temporal region
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: A temporal interval is a special kind of one-dimensional temporal region, namely one that is self-connected (is without gaps or breaks).

nodes.name: temporal region
editor_note: Temporal region doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't exhaust all possibilites. An example would be the mereological sum of a temporal instant and a temporal interval that doesn't overlap the instant. In this case the resultant temporal region is neither 0-dimensional nor 1-dimensional

nodes.name: agent
description: Agent is a role of a person or organisation that directs its activity towards achieving goals.

nodes.name: role
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: One major family of examples of non-rigid universals involves roles, and ontologies developed for corresponding administrative purposes may consist entirely of representatives of entities of this sort. Thus ‘professor’, defined as follows,b instance_of professor at t =Def. there is some c, c instance_of professor role & c inheres_in b at t.denotes a non-rigid universal and so also do ‘nurse’, ‘student’, ‘colonel’, ‘taxpayer’, and so forth. (These terms are all, in the jargon of philosophy, phase sortals.) By using role terms in definitions, we can create a BFO conformant treatment of such entities drawing on the fact that, while an instance of professor may be simultaneously an instance of trade union member, no instance of the type professor role is also (at any time) an instance of the type trade union member role (any more than any instance of the type color is at any time an instance of the type length).If an ontology of employment positions should be defined in terms of roles following the above pattern, this enables the ontology to do justice to the fact that individuals instantiate the corresponding universals –  professor, sergeant, nurse – only during certain phases in their lives.

nodes.name: optimisation
description: An optimisation is a model calculation with the goal to find a best choice or result for at least one variable or function in the model.

nodes.name: model calculation
description: A model calculation is a process of solving mathematical equations of a model.

nodes.name: checking against measurements
description: Checking against measurements is a validation where something gets checked by using relevant measurements.

nodes.name: validation
description: Validation is the process of checking if something works correctly.

nodes.name: solar thermal energy transformation
description: Solar thermal energy transformation is a solar energy transformation that converts solar energy into thermal energy.

nodes.name: solar energy transformation
description: Solar energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts solar energy.

nodes.name: meteorological year
description: A meteorological year is a time step in which meteorological data was collected and that has a duration of one year.

nodes.name: B7
description: B7 is a diesel fuel that consists of fossil diesel fuel and up to 7 % biodiesel.

nodes.name: diesel fuel
description: A diesel fuel is a combustion fuel that has a diesel fuel role.

nodes.name: chemical energy storage object
description: A chemical energy storage object is an energy storage object that has the function to store chemical energy.

nodes.name: continuant fiat boundary
description: b is a continuant fiat boundary = Def. b is an immaterial entity that is of zero, one or two dimensions and does not include a spatial region as part. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [029-001])
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: a continuant fiat boundary is a boundary of some material entity (for example: the plane separating the Northern and Southern hemispheres; the North Pole), or it is a boundary of some immaterial entity (for example of some portion of airspace). Three basic kinds of continuant fiat boundary can be distinguished (together with various combination kinds [29

Continuant fiat boundary doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. An example would be the mereological sum of two-dimensional continuant fiat boundary and a one dimensional continuant fiat boundary that doesn't overlap it. The situation is analogous to temporal and spatial regions.

BFO 2 Reference: In BFO 1.1 the assumption was made that the external surface of a material entity such as a cell could be treated as if it were a boundary in the mathematical sense. The new document propounds the view that when we talk about external surfaces of material objects in this way then we are talking about something fiat. To be dealt with in a future version: fiat boundaries at different levels of granularity.More generally, the focus in discussion of boundaries in BFO 2.0 is now on fiat boundaries, which means: boundaries for which there is no assumption that they coincide with physical discontinuities. The ontology of boundaries becomes more closely allied with the ontology of regions.

nodes.name: electricity import value
description: An electricity export value is an electrical energy amount value that measures the export of electrical energy.

nodes.name: electrical energy amount value
description: An electrical energy amount value is an energy amount value that measures a quantity of electrical energy.

nodes.name: gigawatt-hour
description: An energy unit which is equal to 10^9 watt-hours.

nodes.name: nuclear fission
description: Nuclear fission is a process of nuclear reaction or a radioactive decay in which the nucleus of an atom splits into two or more smaller, lighter nuclei.

nodes.name: emission scenario
description: An emission scenario is a scenario that describes a possible emission trajectory.

nodes.name: renewable power plant
description: A renewable power plant is a power plant that has renewable power units as parts.

nodes.name: air
description: Air is a gas mixture that forms the Earth's atmosphere.

nodes.name: gas mixture
description: A gas mixture is a portion of matter that is a composition of different kinds of portions of matter and that has a gaseous normal state of matter.

nodes.name: ambient thermal energy
description: Ambient thermal energy is thermal energy that is stored in the ambient air, beneath the surface of solid earth or in surface water. It is captured by heat pumps.

nodes.name: volume unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of space occupied by any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas." [NIST:NIST]

nodes.name: field photovoltaic power plant
description: A field photovoltaic power plant (also: solar farm, solar park) is a photovoltaic power plant that is installed out in the open on the ground.

nodes.name: photovoltaic power plant
description: A photovoltaic power plant is a solar power plant that has PV panels as parts.

nodes.name: liquid combustion fuel
description: A liquid combustion fuel is a combustion fuel that has a liquid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: combustion fuel
description: A combustion fuel is a fuel that realises its fuel role in processes that release energy in the form of heat or work by chemical reaction with other substances.

nodes.name: CRF-based sector division
description: A CRF-based sector division is a sector division that is derived from a common reporting format.

nodes.name: sector division
description: A sector division is a specific way to subdivide a system.

nodes.name: model calibration
description: Model calibration is a process of varying exogenous data, so that the model reproduces the known data (e.g. historical) as far as possible, and thus a part of validation.

nodes.name: non associated gas
description: Non associated gas is natural gas originating from fields producing hydrocarbons only in gaseous form.

nodes.name: carbon storage
description: Carbon storage is a process that stores CO2 in a geological formation.

nodes.name: energy storage capacity
description: An energy storage capacity is the quantity value stating the maximum energy an energy storage object can store.

nodes.name: maximum value
description: A maximum value is a quantity value that represents the upper limit of an artificial object or process to contain or transform another entity.

nodes.name: cross-checking against other models
description: Cross-checking against other models is a validation where a model gets cross-checked against other models of the domain.

nodes.name: marine current energy converting unit
description: A marine current energy converting unit is a hydro power unit that uses marine current energy.

nodes.name: hydro power unit
description: A hydro power unit is a power generating unit that uses hydro energy.

nodes.name: PtL fuel
description: PtL fuel is a liquid synthetic fuel produced in a power-to-liquid system from water and carbon dioxide using electrical energy.

nodes.name: liquid synthetic fuel
description: A liquid synthetic fuel is a synthetic fuel that has a liquid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: time series
description: A time series is a data set that references to a set of time steps or zero-dimensional temporal regions.

nodes.name: data set
description: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.
editor_note: 2014-05-05: Data sets are aggregates and thus must include two or more data items. We have chosen not to add logical axioms to make this restriction.

2009/10/23 Alan Ruttenberg. The intention is that this term represent collections of like data. So this isn't for, e.g. the whole contents of a cel file, which includes parameters, metadata etc. This is more like java arrays of a certain rather specific type

nodes.name: gas grid component
description: A gas grid component is a grid component that is part of a gas grid.

nodes.name: grid component
description: A grid component is an energy transformation unit that is a discrete part of a supply grid serving a specific purpose.

nodes.name: rock
description: A rock is a portion of matter that is a naturally occurring solid aggregate of minerals or mineraloid matter that is part of the earth's crust.

nodes.name: reservoir
description: A reservoir is an artificial object that stores liquid water and has a dam as part.
editor_note: Reservoirs created by dams provide water for activities such as hydro energy transformation, irrigation, human consumption, industrial use, aquaculture, and navigability. They are also used to regulate floods.

nodes.name: political assumption
description: A political assumption is an assumption about political measures taken.

nodes.name: assumption
description: An assumption is an information content entity about a property of a system or process. It determines a part of a scenario content.

nodes.name: single axis tracked receiving surface
description: A single axis tracked receiving surface is a solar radiation receiving surface that participates in single axis tracking.

nodes.name: solar radiation receiving surface
description: A solar radiation receiving surface is a surface that is receiving solar energy via solar radiation.

nodes.name: geothermal heat transfer
description: Geothermal heat transfer is a heat transfer from the earth crust to a transportable material entity. E.g. a liquid or gas.

nodes.name: angle unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the figure or space formed by the junction of two lines or planes." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: with existing measures scenario
description: A with existing measures scenario (WEM) is a policy scenario that includes policy instruments and transformative measures that have been adopted and implemented.

nodes.name: policy scenario
description: A policy scenario is a scenario in which certain policy instruments or transformative measures and their impacts are assessed.

nodes.name: material entity
description: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Object, Fiat Object Part and Object Aggregate are not intended to be exhaustive of Material Entity. Users are invited to propose new subcategories of Material Entity.

BFO 2 Reference: Material entities (continuants) can preserve their identity even while gaining and losing material parts. Continuants are contrasted with occurrents, which unfold themselves in successive temporal parts or phases [60

BFO 2 Reference: ‘Matter’ is intended to encompass both mass and energy (we will address the ontological treatment of portions of energy in a later version of BFO). A portion of matter is anything that includes elementary particles among its proper or improper parts: quarks and leptons, including electrons, as the smallest particles thus far discovered; baryons (including protons and neutrons) at a higher level of granularity; atoms and molecules at still higher levels, forming the cells, organs, organisms and other material entities studied by biologists, the portions of rock studied by geologists, the fossils studied by paleontologists, and so on.Material entities are three-dimensional entities (entities extended in three spatial dimensions), as contrasted with the processes in which they participate, which are four-dimensional entities (entities extended also along the dimension of time).According to the FMA, material entities may have immaterial entities as parts – including the entities identified below as sites; for example the interior (or ‘lumen’) of your small intestine is a part of your body. BFO 2.0 embodies a decision to follow the FMA here.

nodes.name: areal power density unit
description: An areal power density unit is a unit which is a measure for the power per surface area.

nodes.name: coal power plant
description: A coal power plant is a power plant that has coal power units as parts.

nodes.name: NC/BR sector division
description:
The NC/BR sector division is a CRF-based sector division defined by the UNFCCC reporting guidelines on national communications for Parties included in Annex I to the Convention.
(https://unfccc.int/sites/default/files/resource/cp2019_13a01_adv.pdf, 6/CP.25, VI, Table 2)

nodes.name: vehicle-kilometre
description: Vehicle-kilometre is a transport performance unit for the accumulated transport distance of the used vehicles themselves where one vehicle-kilometre equals the transport distance of 1 km for one vehicle.

nodes.name: transport performance unit
description: A transport performance unit is a unit of measurement for the accumulated transport distance of a number of people and/or amount of goods.

nodes.name: solar energy
description: Solar energy is radiative energy of the sun.

nodes.name: radiative energy
description: Radiative energy is energy that has been transmitted by a radiation process.

nodes.name: data postprocessing
description: Data postprocessing is data processing that transforms the output of a model calculation into a form that is suitable for presentation.

nodes.name: marine current energy power plant
description: A marine current energy power plant is a power plant that has marine current energy units as parts.

nodes.name: hydro power plant
description: A hydro power plant is a power plant having an aggregate of hydro power generating units as its power generating unit parts.

nodes.name: gas turbine process
description: A gas turbine process is an energy transformation that converts chemical energy into rotational energy using a continous internal combustion process. A gas turbine is participating in a gas turbine process.

nodes.name: jet fuel turbine
description: A jet fuel turbine is a turbine fueled with jet fuel.

nodes.name: gas turbine
description: A gas turbine is a turbine that participates in a gas turbine process. It is also called combustion turbine.

nodes.name: primary energy carrier
description: A primary energy carrier is an energy carrier that has the disposition primary energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: energy carrier
description: An energy carrier is a material entity that has an energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: desorption
description: Desorption is a process that leads to a detaching of a substance that was accumulated within a phase or at an interface between two phases (for example by adsorption).

nodes.name: quality control flag
description: A quality control flag is a data descriptor that describes the measurement quality of a data set, e.g. a time series.

nodes.name: data descriptor
description: A data descriptor is an information content entity that contains additional information about some data.

nodes.name: steel
description: Steel is a metal that consists mainly of iron and up to 2.14 % of carbon; other elements may be present. It has a solid normal state of matter. It has a solid normal state of matter. It is the physical output of an industrial process and has a commodity role.

nodes.name: metal
description: A metal is a portion of matter consisting of an atom of an element that exhibits typical metallic properties, being typically shiny, with high electrical and thermal conductivity.

nodes.name: energy system model
description: An energy system model is a model of an energy system.

nodes.name: sufficiency scenario
description: A sufficiency scenario is a scenario that comprises sufficiency strategies.

nodes.name: geothermal heat unit
description: A geothermal heat unit is a heat transfer unit that uses geothermal energy as source.

nodes.name: heat transfer unit
description: A heat transfer unit is a heat generating unit that contains a heat exchanger and not a heater.

nodes.name: underground fuel storage object
description: An underground fuel storage object is an energy storage object that stores chemical energy in form of fuels underground.

nodes.name: simulation
description: A simulation is a model calculation that simulates a process or system behaviour from the real world.

nodes.name: AC-line
description: An AC-line is a powerline for transferring high voltage alternating current.

nodes.name: hard coal power plant
description: A hard coal power plant is a coal power plant that has hard coal power units as parts.

nodes.name: electric mobility technology
description: An electric mobility is a technology that describes how electric vehicles participate in transport.

nodes.name: mobility technology
description: A mobility technology is a technology that describes how vehicles participate in transport

nodes.name: liquid renewable fuel
description: A liquid renewable fuel is a renewable fuel that has a liquid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: renewable fuel
description: A renewable fuel is a fuel that has a renewable origin and an renewable energy carrier disposition

nodes.name: private funder
description: A private funder is a funder that gives private money.

nodes.name: funder
description: A funder is a sponsor that supports by giving money.

nodes.name: ethanol
description: Ethanol is a portion of matter with the chemical formula C2H6O. It has a liquid normal state of matter and can be used as a combustion fuel.

nodes.name: data center
description: A datacenter is an artificial object that houses computer systems and associated components.

nodes.name: decarbonisation pathway
description: A decarbonisation pathway is a policy that aims at long-term emissions reductions.

nodes.name: policy
description: A policy is a specifically dependent continuant that is a deliberate system of principles, rules and guidelines, adopted by an organisation to guide decision making with respect to particular situations and implemented to achieve stated goals.

nodes.name: simulation model
description: A simulation model is a model that simulates the behaviour of a system without a target function.

nodes.name: contract
description: A contract is a document that contains an agreement between two or more competent agents to which those agents agree to be legally bound.

nodes.name: surface azimuth angle
description: A surface azimuth angle is a quantity value with a plane angle unit that measures the deviation of the projection on a horizontal plane of the normal to the plane from the local meridian, with zero due south, east negative, and west positive.

nodes.name: combined heat and power generation process
description: A combined heat and power generation (CHP) process is an energy transformation that converts energy simultaneously to electrical energy and thermal energy.

nodes.name: fuel cell
description: A fuel cell is a generator that converts chemical energy into electricity using redox reactions.

nodes.name: generator
description: A generator is an energy converting component that converts other forms of energy into electrical energy.

nodes.name: industrial grid-bound heating
description: Industrial grid-bound heating is a grid-bound heating transfer to industrial installations.

nodes.name: grid-bound heating
description: Grid-bound heating is a heat transfer over a distance via a heating grid, using steam or (hot) water.

nodes.name: power-to-methane system
description: A power-to-methane system is a power-to-gas system that implements the power-to-methane process.

nodes.name: thermal energy storage object
description: A thermal energy storage object is an energy storage object that has the function to store thermal energy.

nodes.name: length value
description: Length value is a quantity value that has a length unit as unit.

nodes.name: surface
description: A surface is a tangential proper part of an object that extends in two dimensions.

nodes.name: tangential proper part
description: A tangential proper part is a fiat object part of an entity which shares a boundary with that entity.

nodes.name: international transport sector
description: An international transport sector is a transport sector of international transport processes.

nodes.name: transport sector
description: A transport sector is a sector that covers transport of people and/or goods.

nodes.name: study report
description: A study report is a report that is the output from some study.

nodes.name: climate neutrality criterion
description: A climate neutrality criterion is a plan specification that intends to describe a state in which human activities result in no net effect on the climate system.

nodes.name: square kilometer
description: An area unit which is equal to one million square meters or 10^[6] m^[2].

nodes.name: area unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of a 2-dimensional flat surface." [UOC:GVG]

nodes.name: waste power unit
description: A waste power unit is a power generating unit using waste as fuel.

nodes.name: motorcycle
description: A motorcycle is a motorised road vehicle that has two wheels.

nodes.name: motorised road vehicle
description: A motorised road vehicle is a road vehicle that has a traction motor.

nodes.name: train station
description: A train station is a transport hub for trains.

nodes.name: transport hub
description: A transport hub is a transport network component that allows the exchange of people and/or goods.

nodes.name: text file format
description: A text file format is a file format that is structured as a sequence of lines of electronic text.

nodes.name: data file format
description: A file format is a data format that describes how data is structured in a file.

nodes.name: primary control
description: A primary control is a frequency control that is decentralised and automated. It reacts within seconds to frequency deviations caused by electricity supply and demand imbalances.

nodes.name: frequency control
description: Frequency control is a process that regulates the electricity output of an artificial object to maintain the equilibrium between electricity supply and demand.

nodes.name: forecast error
description: A forecast error is a quantity value that quantifies the difference between a measured and a forecasted value.

nodes.name: nuclear electrical energy
description: Nuclear electrical energy is electrical energy with a nuclear origin.

nodes.name: electrical energy
description: Electrical energy is a form of energy derived from the potential or kinetic energy of charged particles.

nodes.name: carbon tax
description: Carbon tax is a tax for emitting CO2 or other greenhouse gases (measured in CO2 equivalent values).

nodes.name: tax
description: A tax is a levy whose returns are used by the government to finance expenditures for the common welfare.

nodes.name: program parameter
description: A program parameter is a variable in a software.

nodes.name: variable
description: A variable is an information content entity that represents a changeable value, vector, matrix or function within a mathematical expression.

nodes.name: hybrid
description: Hybrid is an analytical approach that combines the top down and the bottom up approach. Some parts are based on composition approach while other parts are based on decomposition approach.

nodes.name: analytical approach
description: A analytical approach is a model descriptor that contains information about the analysis strategy of a model.

nodes.name: non-scattered radiant flux density
description: A non-scattered radiant flux density is an areal solar power density that measures the direct solar radiation within the extent of the solar disk only (half-angle 0.266 deg).

nodes.name: areal solar power density
description: An areal solar power density is an areal power density that indicates the arriving solar power per area. A synonym for areal solar power density is irradiance.

nodes.name: reservoir hydro storage power plant
description: A reservoir hydro storage power plant is a hydro storage power plant that has no pump.

nodes.name: hydro storage power plant
description: A hydro storage power plant is a hydro power plant that uses the available hydro energy of a stationary water storage.
editor_note: The distinction between a run of river power plant and a hydro storage power plant is important for modelling, but in reality not so easy. The chosen distinction follows the document: European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity (ENTSO-E): Hydropower modelling – New database complementing PECD, V.1.0, 12 December 2019, https://www.entsoe.eu/Documents/SDC%20documents/MAF/2019/Hydropower_Modelling_New_database_and_methodology.pdf

nodes.name: rural population
description: A rural population is a population living in rural areas, as defined by national statistical offices.

nodes.name: population
description: A population is an aggregate of people in a spatial region.

nodes.name: fuel supply system
description: A fuel supply system is an energy system covering the distribution of fuels.

nodes.name: energy system
description: An energy system is a supply system of spatially extended linked energy sources and sinks.

nodes.name: carbon dioxide
description: Carbon dioxide is a portion of matter with the chemical formula CO2. It has a gaseous normal state of matter. It occurs naturally in the atmosphere as a trace gas and can work as a greenhouse gas.

nodes.name: code documentation
description: A code documentation is a documentation explaining and annotating software code.

nodes.name: with additional measures scenario
description: A with additional measures scenario (WAM) is a policy scenario that includes policy instruments and transformative measures which have been adopted and implemented to mitigate climate change or meet energy objectives, as well as policy instruments and transformative measures which are planned for that purpose.

nodes.name: potential
description: A potential is a maximum value that describes some upper limit in a spatial region of reference.

nodes.name: water electrolysis process
description: A water electrolysis process is an energy transformation that uses an electric current to decompose water into hydrogen and oxygen gas. Electrical energy is converted into chemical energy (and waste heat).

nodes.name: start time
description: A start time is a zero-dimensional temporal region that indicates the beginning of a one-dimensional temporal region.

nodes.name: non-energy use
description: Non-energy use is the consumption of an energy carrier without making use the energy it carries.

nodes.name: gas diesel oil
description: Gas/diesel oil is a portion of matter that is primarily a medium distillate distilling between 180 °C and 380 °C. Includes blending components. Several grades are available depending on uses.

nodes.name: charging
description: Charging is an electrical energy transfer where the transferred energy is stored in a battery.

nodes.name: electrical energy transfer
description: Electrical energy transfer is an energy transfer of electrical energy.

nodes.name: gasoline fuel role
description: A gasoline fuel role is a fuel role that expresses that a portion of matter can be used in a gasoline engine.
editor_note: The term gasoline was chosen as this term is more often used in energy modelling and energy statistics. This is a deliberate deviation from the convention of British English spelling in the OEO.

nodes.name: fuel role
description: A fuel role is a role of a portion of matter that has the disposition to be an energy carrier and is used in a process that releases the carried energy by transforming the portion of matter into a different kind of portion of matter in a way that releases heat or does work.

nodes.name: fuel market exchange
description: A fuel market exchange is an energy market exchange where fuels like oil, coal, renewable fuels, and natural gas are traded.

nodes.name: energy market exchange
description: An energy market exchange is a market exchange in which energy commodities are traded.

nodes.name: energy service demand for passenger-kilometre
description: Energy service demand for passenger-kilometre is the energy service demand that is consumed to transport one person over a distance of one kilometre.

nodes.name: energy service demand
description: An energy service demand is a demand of an agent to use energy as a means to obtain or facilitate desired end services or states.
editor_note: An example is the transport demand for goods or persons (e.g. in person/tonne-kilometres). An other example is the demand for room heating or cooling.

nodes.name: biogas
description: Biogas is a gas mixture produced by anaerobic digestion. It consists mainly of methane and carbon dioxide and can be used as fuel.

nodes.name: diesel car
description: A diesel car is a car that has only a diesel engine as motor for propulsion and thus is also a diesel vehicle.

nodes.name: car
description: A car is a motorised road vehicle that is used for passenger transport and has a maximum of eight seats.

nodes.name: sectoral energy consumption
description: A sectoral energy consumption is the energy use of a sector.

nodes.name: energy use
description: Energy use is the consumption of an energy carrier making use of the energy it carries.

nodes.name: marine current energy
description: Marine current energy is the natural hydro energy of an ocean current.

nodes.name: natural hydro energy
description: Natural hydro energy is hydro energy collected from the natural water cycle (rainwater, melted snow and ice).

nodes.name: anthropogenic
description: Anthropogenic is an origin of portions of matter or energies created by human activity.

nodes.name: origin
description: Origin is a quality of a portion of matter or energy based on where it comes from. It is inherited from its primary sources.

nodes.name: million ton of coal equivalent
description: A million ton of coal equivalent is an energy unit which is equal to 1,000,000 tons of coal equivalent.

nodes.name: organisation role
description: An organisation role is a role of an aggregate of people that has a collective goal and a set of organisation rules.

nodes.name: quantitist
description: A quantitist is an OEP user who mainly interacts with quantitative information.

nodes.name: OEP user
description: An OEP user is a user who interacts with the Open Energy Platform.

nodes.name: relational quality
description: b is a relational quality = Def. for some independent continuants c, d and for some time t: b quality_of c at t & b quality_of d at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [057-001])

nodes.name: transport
description: Transport is the process of moving people or goods from one place to another.

nodes.name: nitric oxide
description: Nitric oxide is a portion of matter with the chemical formula NO. It is a gas and can act as an air pollutant. Synonyms are nitrogen oxide or nitrogen monoxide.

nodes.name: nitrogen oxides
description: Nitrogen oxides are a portion of matter consisting of compounds of nitrogen and oxygen. It is a collective term for numerous oxides of nitrogen with a gaseous normal state of matter. They can act as air pollutants.

nodes.name: wind energy transformation
description: Wind energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts wind energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: external optimiser
description: An external optimiser is a software external to a model that computes an optimisation.

nodes.name: software
description:
Software is a plan specification composed of a series of instructions that can be 
interpreted by or directly executed by a processing unit.
editor_note: see sourceforge tracker discussion at http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1958818&group_id=177891&atid=886178

nodes.name: methanation
description: A methanation is a redox reaction that converts carbon dioxide and hydrogen to synthetic methane and water.

nodes.name: redox reaction
description: A redox reaction is a chemical reaction in which the oxidation of one reactant is coupled to the reduction of a second reactant.

nodes.name: liquefied natural gas truck
description: A liquefied natural gas truck is a truck that uses liquefied natural gas in a gas engine for propulsion and thus is also a liquefied natural gas vehicle.

nodes.name: truck
description: A truck is a motorised road vehicle that is used for freight transport.

nodes.name: full load hours
description: Full load hours are a quantity value that describes the utilization of a technical device. The value of the full load hours is obtained by dividing the annual amount of energy generated by the declared net capacity of the plant.

nodes.name: carbon capture and storage
description: Carbon capture and storage (CCS) is a process that combines carbon capture and carbon sequestration.

nodes.name: gaseous combustion fuel
description: A gaseous combustion fuel is a combustion fuel that has a gaseous state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: river
description: A river is a water body that moves through permanent or seasonal flow process from elevated land towards lower elevations through a definite channel and empties either into a sea, lake, or another river or ends on land as bed seepage and evapotranspiration exceed water supply.

nodes.name: water body
description: A water body is an accumulation of liquid water of varying size on the surface of the Earth.

nodes.name: pumped hydro energy
description: Pumped hydro energy is hydro energy that results from a water flow of pumped water.

nodes.name: hydro energy
description: Hydro energy is kinetic energy of moving liquid water which can result directly from its potential energy.

nodes.name: marine wave energy technology
description: A marine wave energy technology is a marine hydro power technology that describes how to combine marine wave energy converting units in marine wave energy transformations.

nodes.name: vehicle charging station
description: A vehicle charging station is an electricity grid component that transfers electrical energy into the traction battery of a battery electric vehicle.

nodes.name: electricity grid component
description: An electricity grid component is a grid component that is part of an electricity grid.

nodes.name: internal combustion engine
description: An internal combustion engine is a motor that converts chemical energy into kinetic energy using a cyclic combustion process.

nodes.name: electrolytic hydrogen
description: Electrolytic hydrogen is hydrogen that is a physical output of a water electrolysis process.

nodes.name: public funder
description: A public funder is a funder that gives public money.

nodes.name: population count
description: A population count is a quantity value to measure the size of a population.

nodes.name: exchange rate
description: The exchange rate is an economic value representing the ratio at which one currency can be exchanged for another.

nodes.name: combustion fuel transport
description: Combustion fuel transport is the fuel transport of combustion fuels.

nodes.name: fuel transport
description: Fuel transport is the freight transport of fuels.

nodes.name: fuel cell electric vehicle
description: A fuel cell electric vehicle (FCEV) is an electric vehicle that uses electrical energy from a fuel cell.

nodes.name: model descriptor
description: A model descriptor is an information content entity that contains information about some model.

nodes.name: traction battery
description: A traction battery is a battery that is used in vehicles for propulsion.

nodes.name: aggregation type
description: An aggregation type is a data descriptor that contains information on the aggregation method applied on a data set.

nodes.name: adsorption
description: Adsorption is a process that leads to an accumulation of a substance within a phase or at an interface between two phases.

nodes.name: latent fluid-gaseous heat storage object
description: A latent fluid-gaseous heat storage object is a latent heat storage object that stores thermal energy by converting liquid materials to their gaseous equivalent i.e. evaporating the material.

nodes.name: combustible energy carrier disposition
description: A combustible energy carrier is an energy carrier that releases energy from a material entity in form of heat or work, by chemical reaction with other substances.

nodes.name: energy carrier disposition
description: An energy carrier disposition is a disposition of an material entity that contains energy for conversion as usable energy.

nodes.name: bicycle
description: A bicycle is a road vehicle that has two wheels and is propelled by a person.

nodes.name: road vehicle
description: A road vehicle is a vehicle that uses roads.

nodes.name: space requirement
description: A space requirement is a two-dimensional spatial region that covers the area needed by an object or object aggregate.

nodes.name: programming language
description: A language in which source code is written that is intended to be executed/run by a software interpreter. Programming languages are ways to write instructions that specify what to do, and sometimes, how to do it.

nodes.name: curtailment
description: Curtailment is a process in which a power generating unit is forced to reduce its output, in order to balance energy supply and demand or due to transmission constraints.

nodes.name: final energy carrier disposition
description: Final energy carrier disposition is an energy carrier disposition of material entities that are delivered to energy consumers for their use.

nodes.name: cooperative programming
description: Cooperative programming is the process of two or more people working on program code together at the same time (according to a specified routine).

nodes.name: refinery gas
description: Refinery gas is a gas mixture that is produced as a by-product of a mineral oil refining process. It mainly consists of hydrogen, methane, ethane and olefins and can be used as a fuel.

nodes.name: ocean
description: The ocean is a water body that consists of salt water and is covering approximately 71% of Earth's surface.

nodes.name: energy transformation function
description: An energy transformation function is the function of an artificial object that has been engineered to transform input energy into usable output energy of a different type.

nodes.name: function
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: In the past, we have distinguished two varieties of function, artifactual function and biological function. These are not asserted subtypes of BFO:function however, since the same function – for example: to pump, to transport – can exist both in artifacts and in biological entities. The asserted subtypes of function that would be needed in order to yield a separate monoheirarchy are not artifactual function, biological function, etc., but rather transporting function, pumping function, etc.

nodes.name: energy balance sector division
description: An energy balance sector division is a sector division that is defined by an energy balance calculation method.

nodes.name: heating grid
description: A heating grid is a supply grid that distributes thermal energy via circulating steam or liquids.

nodes.name: supply grid
description: A supply grid is an object aggregate of systematically connected artificial objects that can work as a supply system.

nodes.name: fiat object part
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Most examples of fiat object parts are associated with theoretically drawn divisions

nodes.name: gaseous fossil fuel
description: A gaseous fossil fuel is a fossil combustion fuel that has a gaseous state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: fossil combustion fuel
description: A fossil combustion fuel is a combustion fuel with the origin fossil.

nodes.name: mineral oil
description: A mineral oil is a fossil combustion fuel that is either crude oil or a mineral oil product.

nodes.name: inflation rate
description: Inflation rate is an economic value reprensenting the ratio between the monetary price for a good at two different points in time that equalises differences in monetary price levels between these two points in time.

nodes.name: code source
description: A code source is a data descriptor describing the origin of some code.

nodes.name: household sector
description: A household sector is a sector that covers households.

nodes.name: energy demand sector
description: An energy demand sector is a sector that covers energy consumers.

nodes.name: carbon capture
description: Carbon capture is a process that captures carbon dioxide from a gas. test

nodes.name: solid biomass power plant
description: A solid biomass power plant is a biofuel power plant that has solid biomass power units as parts.

nodes.name: biofuel power plant
description: A biofuel power plant is a power plant that has biofuel power units as parts.

nodes.name: energy balancing
description: Energy balancing is a process that levels out energy supply and demand for system stability.

nodes.name: perfluorocarbon
description: Perfluorocarbons (PFCs) are portions of matter consisting of organic compounds that contain fluorine atoms but no hydrogen atoms.

nodes.name: combustion thermal energy transformation
description: A combustion thermal energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts chemical energy of a combustion fuel into thermal energy.

nodes.name: power-to-fuel process
description: A power-to-fuel process is an energy transformation that converts electrical energy to chemical energy by synthesising portions of matter into a synthetic fuel.

nodes.name: HVDC-line
description: An HVDC-line is a powerline for transferring high voltage direct current.

nodes.name: directive information entity
description: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process.
editor_note: 2009-03-16: provenance: a term realizable information entity was proposed for OBI (OBI_0000337) , edited by the PlanAndPlannedProcess branch. Original definition was  "is the specification of a process that can be concretized and realized by an actor" with alternative term  "instruction".It has been subsequently moved to IAO where the objective for which the original term was defined was satisfied with the definitionof this, different, term.

Werner pushed back on calling it realizable information entity as it isn't realizable. However this name isn't right either. An example would be a recipe. The realizable entity would be a plan, but the information entity isn't about the plan, it, once concretized, *is* the plan. -Alan
8/6/2009 Alan Ruttenberg: Changed label from "information entity about a realizable" after discussions at ICBO

2013-05-30 Alan Ruttenberg: What differentiates a directive information entity from an information concretization is that it can have concretizations that are either qualities or realizable entities. The concretizations that are realizable entities are created when an individual chooses to take up the direction, i.e. has the intention to (try to) realize it.

nodes.name: secondary energy carrier
description: A secondary energy carrier is an energy carrier that has the secondary energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: spatial region
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Spatial regions do not participate in processes.

Spatial region doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't exhaust all possibilites. An example would be the union of a spatial point and a spatial line that doesn't overlap the point, or two spatial lines that intersect at a single point. In both cases the resultant spatial region is neither 0-dimensional, 1-dimensional, 2-dimensional, or 3-dimensional.

nodes.name: decommissioning time
description: A decommissioning time is a time span that measures the time that is needed to decommission an artificial object.

nodes.name: time span
description: A time span is a quantity value indicating the duration of a one-dimensional temporal region, measured in a time unit.

nodes.name: solar electrolytic hydrogen
description: Solar electrolytic hydrogen is electrolytic hydrogen that is produced with solar electrical energy.

nodes.name: commercial sector
description: A commercial sector is a sector that covers non-industrial commercial activities.

nodes.name: emission factor
description: An emission factor is a process attribute that quantifies the emissions or removals of a gas per unit activity.

nodes.name: parameterisation
description: Parameterisation is the process of translating assumptions into exogenous data the model can use.

nodes.name: waste fuel
description: A waste fuel is a fuel in which the material entity is waste.

nodes.name: fuel
description: A fuel is a portion of matter that has the disposition to be an energy carrier and that has a fuel role.

nodes.name: main activity energy producer
description: A main activity energy producer is an organisational energy producer whose primary activity is electrical energy and/or heat production.

nodes.name: organisational energy producer
description: An organisational energy producer is an organisation that undertakes the generation of electricity and/or heat."

nodes.name: considered region
description: A considered region is a spatial region that is used in an analysis.

nodes.name: nitrous oxide
description: Nitrous oxide is a portion of matter with the chemical formula N2O. It has a gaseous normal state of matter. It occurs naturally in the atmosphere as a trace gas and it can work as a greenhouse gas.

nodes.name: pumped hydro storage power plant
description: A pumped hydro storage power plant is a hydro storage power plant which has some pumps as parts.

nodes.name: time stamp alignment
description: A time stamp alignment is a data descriptor that indicates the position of a time stamp in a time step.

nodes.name: sector
description: A sector is generically dependent continuant that is a subdivision of a system.

nodes.name: generically dependent continuant
description: b is a generically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant that g-depends_on one or more other entities. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [074-001])

nodes.name: liquid water
description: Liquid water is water that has a liquid state of matter.

nodes.name: water
description: Water is a portion of matter with the chemical formula H2O. It has a liquid normal state of matter.
editor_note: We are aware that water is defined as pure H2O in the OEO and that naturally occurring water usually also contains impurities of other portions of matter (e.g. minerals). We purposely neglect this inconsistency for usability reasons.

nodes.name: database
description: A database is an information content entity that stores data items and data sets.

nodes.name: steam
description: Steam is water that has a gaseous state of matter.

nodes.name: petroleum coke
description: Petroleum coke is a portion of matter with a solid state of matter that is produced in a mineral oil refining process. It consists mainly of carbon and can be uses as a fuel.

nodes.name: day
description: "A time unit which is equal to 24 hours." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: biogas power unit
description: A biogas power unit is a biofuel power unit using biogas as fuel.

nodes.name: biofuel power unit
description: A biofuel power unit is a power generating unit using biofuel.

nodes.name: volumetric flow rate value
description: A volumetric flow rate value is a quantity value that has a volumetric flow rate unit as unit.

nodes.name: ocean current
description: An ocean current is a a water flow within a water body/marine water body/ocean that is mainly horizontally orientated.

nodes.name: water flow
description: Water flow is a process of liquid water moving.

nodes.name: megawatt-hour
description: An energy unit which is equal to 1,000,000 watt-hours.

nodes.name: emission quantity value
description: An emission quantity value is a quantity value that has a mass unit as unit. It is the quantity value of an emission value.

nodes.name: personal living space
description: A personal living space is a space requirement that one person uses for living.

nodes.name: model role
description: A model role is a a role of a continuant for representing a system and its behaviours in a simplified or idealised way.

nodes.name: algorithm
description: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata.

nodes.name: API
description: An API (Application Programming interface) is a software interface allowing two Software applications to communicate with each other.

nodes.name: software interface
description: A software interface is a software that enables an agent to interact with it.

nodes.name: grid node
description: A grid node is a grid component of a supply grid where two or more links meet.

nodes.name: CO2 emission certificate price
description: A CO2 emission certificate price is an emission price of an CO2 emission certificate that allows the emission of certain CO2 emission value.

nodes.name: emission certificate price
description: Emission certificate price is a monetary price of an emission certificate that allows the emission of a certain emission value.

nodes.name: renewable energy carrier
description: A renewable energy carrier is an energy carrier that has a renewable energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: declared net capacity
description: Declared net capacity is a power capacity stating the maximum power a power generating unit or a power plant can deliver to the electrical grid. It equals the sum of the rated powers of all plant generators minus all power used internally within the plant.

nodes.name: power capacity
description: A power capacity is a maximum value of a generator or power generating unit to generate power.

nodes.name: emission market exchange
description: An emission market exchange is a market exchange where emission certificates are traded

nodes.name: market exchange
description: A market exchange is an organisation that has the market exchange role.

nodes.name: operational life time
