description: An operational life time is the lifetime of an artificial object. It is measured from the end of construction time to the start of decommissioning time.

nodes.name: life time
description: A life time is a time span of an artificial object that measures the time during which the artificial object exists.

nodes.name: fossil
description: Fossil is a geogenic origin of portions of matter created from organic material by geological processes lasting thousands or millions of years.
editor_note: In real world, fossils are from biogenic origin some thousands or millions of years ago. However, this is irrelevant in the energy modelling domain.

nodes.name: geogenic
description: Geogenic is an origin of portions of matter or energies that are the result of geological processes.

nodes.name: aviation gasoline
description: Aviation gasoline is gasoline used as motor spirit and prepared especially for aviation piston engines, with an octane number suited to the engine, a freezing point of -60 °C and a distillation range usually within the limits of 30 °C and 180 °C.
editor_note: The term gasoline was chosen as this term is more often used in energy modelling and energy statistics. This is a deliberate deviation from the convention of British English spelling in the OEO.

nodes.name: gasoline
description: Gasoline (American English) or petrol (British English) is a portion of matter in the form of a transparent petroleum-derived liquid that is used primarily as a fuel in spark-ignited internal combustion engines. It consists mostly of organic compounds obtained by the fractional distillation of petroleum, enhanced with a variety of additives.
https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gasoline&oldid=867948640
editor_note: The term gasoline was chosen as this term is more often used in energy modelling and energy statistics. This is a deliberate deviation from the convention of British English spelling in the OEO.

nodes.name: watercraft
description: A watercraft is a vehicle that is driving through water.

nodes.name: vehicle
description: A vehicle is an artificial object that is used for transporting people or goods.

nodes.name: amortisation time
description: An amortisation time is the time span in which the investment costs are refinanced from the annual profits and depreciation of the investment.

nodes.name: goal description
description: A goal description is an information content entity that contains statements about a desired future state of a system that a person or organisation envisions or plans, or to which it commits.

nodes.name: power rating
description: Power rating is a power capacity stating the maximum power an energy converting component can convert.

nodes.name: solar thermal energy
description: Solar thermal energy is thermal energy that is the physical output of a solar thermal energy transformation.

nodes.name: solar chemical energy transformation
description: A solar chemical energy transformation is a solar energy transformation that converts solar energy into chemical energy.

nodes.name: railway
description: A railway is a transport network component that can only be used by trains.

nodes.name: transport network component
description: A transport network component is an artificial object that is part of a transport network.

nodes.name: chemical energy storage technology
description: An chemical energy storage technology is an energy storage technology that describes how to combine chemical energy storage objects and chemical energy in charging and decharging processes.

nodes.name: energy storage technology
description: An energy storage technology is an energy technology that describes how to combine energy storage objects and energy carriers in charging and decharging processes for the purpose of temporarily storing energy.

nodes.name: nuclear fuel
description: A nuclear fuel is a fuel that realises its fuel role in processes that release energy in the form of heat or work by undergoing nuclear fission.

nodes.name: abated steam reforming hydrogen
description: Abated steam reforming hydrogen is hydrogen that is output of a steam reforming process which is followed by a carbon capture and storage process.

nodes.name: synthetic methane
description: Synthetic methane is methane that has a synthetic origin.

nodes.name: methane
description: Methane is a hydrocarbon with the chemical formula CH4. It has a gaseous normal state of matter. It occurs naturally in the atmosphere as a trace gas and can work as a greenhouse gas. As it can be oxidised it can be used as a fuel.

nodes.name: reduction
description: Reduction is a chemical reaction that describes the gain of electrons of an atom, an ion, or of certain atoms in a molecule and is a part of a redox reaction.

nodes.name: chemical reaction
description: A chemical reaction is a transformation that involves the interconversion of chemical species.

nodes.name: control area
description: A control area is a supply grid that is under the responsibility of a transmission system operator and is a part of a supply grid.

nodes.name: kilo ton of oil equivalent
description: A kilo ton of oil equivalent is an energy unit which is equal to 1,000 tons of oil equivalent.

nodes.name: source code file format
description: A source code file format is a text file format that is source code in a programming language.

nodes.name: prosumer
description: A prosumer is an agent who is producer and consumer at the same time.

nodes.name: combustion
description: Combustion is an exothermic redox reaction between a fuel (the reductant) and an oxidant (usually atmospheric oxygen) which is initiated by a ignition source.

nodes.name: lignite power technology
description: A lignite power technology is a coal power technology that describes how to combine hard coal power units and lignite in a fuel-powered electricity generation process.

nodes.name: coal power technology
description: A coal power technology is a fuel-powered technology that describes how to combine coal power units and coal in a fuel-powered electricity generation process.

nodes.name: economic scenario
description: An economic scenario is a scenario that describes a possible future state of economic systems.

nodes.name: ton of coal equivalent
description: A ton of coal equivalent is an energy unit which is equal to the amount of energy released by burning one metric ton of coal with a certain net calorific value. That is defined as 0.7 tons of oil equivalent (toe) and thus equals 29.3076 gigajoules or 8.141 megawatt-hours.

nodes.name: mineral
description: A mineral is a portion of matter that is normally crystalline formed.

nodes.name: potential energy storage technology
description: An potential energy storage technology is an energy storage technology that describes how to combine potential energy storage objects and potential energy in charging and decharging processes.
editor_note: This technology was introduce for the sake of completeness, but there is no actual use case seen at the moment.

nodes.name: energy autoproducer
description: An energy autoproducer is an organisational energy producer who produces electrical energy and/or heat wholly or partly for their own use as an activity which supports their primary activity.

nodes.name: hard coal
description: Hard coal is coal with a gross calorific value greater than 23 865 kJ/kg (5 700 kcal/kg) on an ashfree but moist basis and with a mean random reflectance of vitrinite of at least 0,6.

nodes.name: run of river power plant
description: A run of river power plant is a hydro power plant that uses the momentarily available hydro energy of a river. It has either no reservoir or just has a small one with a maximum of 24 hours of storage.
editor_note: The distinction between a run of river power plant and a hydro storage power plant is important for modelling, but in reality not so easy. The chosen distinction follows the document: European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity (ENTSO-E): Hydropower modelling – New database complementing PECD, V.1.0, 12 December 2019, https://www.entsoe.eu/Documents/SDC%20documents/MAF/2019/Hydropower_Modelling_New_database_and_methodology.pdf

nodes.name: negative emission
description: Negative emission is the process of absorbing a substance, usually a pollutant that was emitted before.

nodes.name: waste thermal energy
description: Waste thermal energy is thermal energy that is the physical output of an energy transformation process and that is released into the environment unused.

nodes.name: rail network
description: A rail network is a transport network that enables transport on rails.

nodes.name: transport network
description: A transport network is an object aggregate of transport network components that enables the transport of people and/or goods.

nodes.name: delivery cost
description: A delivery cost is a cost for a product or service that refers to the total unit cost of a product or commodity delivered to a certain market, city or customer. It is normally composed of all associated transport costs and the unit cost of production for that product.

nodes.name: cost
description: Cost is an economic value that describes the amount of money needed to buy, make, or do a thing.

nodes.name: recycling
description: Recycling is a material transformation that regains materials and/or energy from an artificial product or waste.

nodes.name: material transformation
description: A material transformation is a transformation in which one or more input material entities are, at least partially, physically changed and result in output material entites.

nodes.name: specifically dependent continuant
description: b is a specifically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant & there is some independent continuant c which is not a spatial region and which is such that b s-depends_on c at every time t during the course of b’s existence. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [050-003])
editor_note: Specifically dependent continuant doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. We're not sure what else will develop here, but for example there are questions such as what are promises, obligation, etc.

nodes.name: rooftop photovoltaic power plant
description: A rooftop photovoltaic power plant is a photovoltaic power plant that is installed on top of the roof of a building.

nodes.name: producer
description: A producer is an agent that makes goods.

nodes.name: wind energy converting unit
description: A wind energy converting unit is a power generating unit that uses wind energy.

nodes.name: peat
description: Peat is a or portion of matter that is a soft, porous or compressed, sedimentary deposit of plant origin with high water content (up to 90 % in the raw state) and can be used as combustion fuel. As the natural formation of peat takes at least centuries, peat is usually considered having a fossil origin.

nodes.name: road
description: A road is a transport network component with an artificial surface that allows transport for road vehicles.

nodes.name: combined cycle electricity generation process
description: A combined cycle electricity generation process is a fuel-powered electricity generation process in which a gas turbine process is followed by an steam-electric process.

nodes.name: fuel-powered electricity generation process
description: A fuel-powered electricity generation process is an electricity generation process that converts chemical energy from a combustion fuel to electrical energy. It causes some emission.

nodes.name: scenario projection
description: A scenario projection is an intentional process in which output (endogenous) data of interest are quantified for future points in time using one or more model calculation based on a scenario.
editor_note:
A scenario projection is an intentional process (with human participation): A scenario is either created or selected, its assumptions are translated into data sets. These datasets are quantified and serve as inputs to a model calculation which is applied to quantitatively project one or more variables of interest into the future.
(Intentional: a research question is basis for the projection to be done)

nodes.name: secondary energy carrier disposition
description: Secondary energy carrier disposition is an energy carrier disposition of material entities that are manufactured from primary energy carriers or from a different form of secondary energy carriers.

nodes.name: delivery time point
description: A delivery time point is a zero-dimensional temporal region expressing the point in time when goods that have been bought arrive at the place where they are wanted.

nodes.name: sulphur hexafluoride
description: Sulphur hexafluoride is a portion of matter with the chemical formula SF6. It has a gaseous normal state of matter. It can work as a potent greenhouse gas and has an anthropogenic origin.

nodes.name: gross electricity generation
description: Gross electricity generation is a process attribute that refers to the total amount of electrical energy produced in an electricity generation process.

nodes.name: two axis tracking
description: Two axis tracking is solar tracking in which a radiation receiving surface is following the sun by rotating around two axes. The surface is always oriented normal.

nodes.name: solar tracking
description: Solar tracking is a process in which a radiation receiving surface is following the path of the sun on the sky.

nodes.name: liquid air production
description: Liquid air production is a production that produces liquid air by cooling and compressing (gaseous) air.

nodes.name: production
description: Production is the transformation process of combining various inputs in order to create an output that is a good.

nodes.name: metric ton
description: Metric ton (t) is a a mass unit which is equal to thousand of a kilogram or 10^3 kg.

nodes.name: mass unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: OEP study factsheet
description: An OEP study factsheet is an study factsheet hosted on the Open Energy Platform. It is used to access the Open Energy Knowledge Graph (OEKG).

nodes.name: study factsheet
description: A study factsheet is a factsheet that contains information about a scenario study.

nodes.name: subsurface collector
description: A subsurface collector is a heat exchanger that transfers ambient thermal energy to a working fluid. It consists of plastic pipes laid horizontally under the ground.

nodes.name: heat exchanger
description: A heat exchanger is an energy converting component that is used for a heat transfer process.

nodes.name: volatility
description: The volatility disposition is the disposition of a portion of matter to sublimate or evaporate from the solid or liquid form and enter the surrounding air.

nodes.name: disposition
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Dispositions exist along a strength continuum. Weaker forms of disposition are realized in only a fraction of triggering cases. These forms occur in a significant number of cases of a similar type.

nodes.name: effort sharing
description: Effort sharing is a policy instrument that sets a common emission reduction goal for a number of countries. Each country has a national reduction goal. Under- or overachievement of that goal can be compensated by trading emission certificates.

nodes.name: gross inland energy consumption
description: Gross inland energy consumption is an energy consumption value accounting for the total consumption of energy in a spatial region (e.g. a country).

nodes.name: energy consumption value
description: An energy consumption value is an energy amount value that measures the energy consumption over a time span.

nodes.name: due
description: A due is an economic value that represents a payment that an agent makes to belong to an organisation.

nodes.name: combustion-based heater
description: A combustion-based heater is a heater that increases the thermal energy using combustion.

nodes.name: heater
description: A heater is an energy converting component that converts other forms of energy into useful heat.

nodes.name: energy
description: Energy is a quality of material entities which manifests as a capacity to perform work (such as causing motion or the interaction of molecules)

nodes.name: boolean value
description: A boolean value is an variable information content entity that can only be true or false.

nodes.name: airport
description: An airport is a transport hub for airplanes.

nodes.name: material sustainability
description: Material sustainability is a disposition is a material entity that conforms to some sustainability criteria.

nodes.name: plane angle unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure of the angle formed by two straight lines in the same plane." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: acceptance
description: Acceptance is a realizable entity that represents the attitude of a person or organisation with respect to a certain constructional, (infra)structural or political measure that may be realized in, affected by or results of complex processes like discussions, communications, transformative measures or former personal experiences.

nodes.name: fuel commodity role
description: Fuel commodity role is the commodity role of fuels.

nodes.name: award
description: An award is a document that signifies that a supplier for a particular commodity or service specified in a bid has been accepted.

nodes.name: electrical energy share
description: Electrical energy share is a process attribute that indicates the fraction of electrical energy related to the total energy of an energy generation or consumption process.

nodes.name: airplane
description: An airplane is an aircraft that has fixed wings.

nodes.name: aircraft
description: An aircraft is a vehicle that is flying in the air.

nodes.name: organisation
description: An organisation is an immaterial entity that has the organisation role and there exists some sort of legal framework that recognises the entity and its continued existence.

nodes.name: economic flow potential
description: An economic flow potential is a type of flow potential that identifies the proportion of the technological potential that can be utilised economically (based on economic boundary conditions).

nodes.name: flow potential
description: A flow potential is a potential of an input or output of a process, per time unit.

nodes.name: kinetic energy
description: Kinetic energy is the energy that a material entity possesses due to its motion. It is defined as the work needed to accelerate a body of a given mass from rest to a stated velocity.

nodes.name: scenario horizon
description: A scenario horizon is a time step that is under investigation and consists entirely of one or more scenario years.

nodes.name: economy
description: An economy is a system of production, distribution, trade and consumption of goods and services.

nodes.name: system
description: A material entity consisting of multiple components that are causally integrated.
editor_note: May be replaced by a BFO class, as discussed in http://www.jbiomedsem.com/content/4/1/43

nodes.name: geothermal energy
description: Geothermal energy is thermal energy that is released from within the earth's crust.

nodes.name: bioethanol
description: Bioethanol is ethanol with a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: biomass
description: Biomass is a portion of matter from plants or animals and has thus has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: compressed-air energy storage unit
description: A compressed-air energy storage unit is an energy storage unit that uses compressed air.

nodes.name: energy storage unit
description: An energy storage unit is a grid component that stores energy.

nodes.name: liquefied petroleum gas car
description: A liquefied petroleum gas car is a car that uses liquefied petroleum gas in a gas engine for propulsion and thus is also a liquefied petroleum gas vehicle.

nodes.name: ton-kilometre
description: Ton-kilometre is a transport performance unit for the accumulated transport distance of goods where one ton-kilometre equals the transport distance of 1 km for one ton of goods.

nodes.name: photovoltaic cell
description: A photovoltaic cell (PV cell) is a generator that converts solar energy into electrical energy.

nodes.name: areal energy density
description: An areal energy density is a quantity value that states a certain energy amount per area.

nodes.name: market participant
description: A market participant is an agent who participates in trading in a market exchange.

nodes.name: sufficiency
description: Sufficiency is a plan specification for reducing, in absolute terms, the consumption and production of end-use products and services through changes in social practices in order to comply with environmental sustainability while ensuring an adequate social foundation for all people.

nodes.name: measurement device
description: A measurement device is an artificial object that is used in some measurement process.

nodes.name: endogenous data
description: Endogenous data is a data item whose quantity value is determined by a model.

nodes.name: data item
description: An information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.

A data item is an information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.
editor_note: 2014-03-31: See discussion at http://odontomachus.wordpress.com/2014/03/30/aboutness-objects-propositions/

JAR: datum     -- well, this will be very tricky to define, but maybe some 
information-like stuff that might be put into a computer and that is 
meant, by someone, to denote and/or to be interpreted by some 
process... I would include lists, tables, sentences... I think I might 
defer to Barry, or to Brian Cantwell Smith

JAR: A data item is an approximately justified approximately true approximate belief
2009-03-16: removed datum as alternative term as datum specifically refers to singular form, and is thus not an exact synonym.
2009-03-16: data item deliberatly ambiguous: we merged data set and datum to be one entity, not knowing how to define singular versus plural. So data item is more general than datum.

2/2/2009 Alan and Bjoern discussing FACS run output data. This is a data item because it is about the cell population. Each element records an event and is typically further composed a set of measurment data items that record the fluorescent intensity stimulated by one of the lasers.

nodes.name: fuel production
description: Fuel production is a production process which has fuel as physical output.

nodes.name: variable production cost
description: Variable costs are costs that depend on the amount of goods or services produced and which are paid by the producer.

nodes.name: variable cost
description: A variable cost is a cost that depends on an amount of goods or services.

nodes.name: tertiary control
description: A tertiary control is a frequency control that is either automated or manual. It takes over from secondary control to equalise electricity supply and demand imbalances that last for more than 15 minutes.

nodes.name: motorised vehicle
description: A motorised vehicle is a vehicle that has a traction motor.

nodes.name: energy scenario
description: An energy scenario is a scenario that describes a possible future state of an energy system.

nodes.name: artificial ambient thermal energy
description: Artificial ambient thermal energy is ambient thermal energy that has an anthropogenic origin.

nodes.name: protected area
description: A protected area is a two-dimensional spatial region recognised, dedicated and managed, through legal or other effective means, to achieve the long term conservation of nature with associated ecosystem services and cultural values.

nodes.name: climate neutral process
description: A climate neutral process is a process that has a process climate neutrality attribute.

nodes.name: bottom up
description: Bottom up is an analytical approach where parts of the system are defined in details. Once these parts are designed and developed, then these parts or components are linked together to prepare a bigger component. This approach is repeated until the complete system is built. A bottom up model is based on a composition approach.

nodes.name: open source
description: open source is a software descriptor labelling software whose source code is available online for free and can be modified or redistributed.

nodes.name: increase
description: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

nodes.name: sensible heat storage object
description: A sensible heat storage object is a thermal energy storage object that stores thermal energy through temperature changes in some medium.

nodes.name: marine tidal energy technology
description: A marine tidal energy technology is a marine hydro power technology that describes how to combine marine tidal energy converting units in marine tidal energy transformations.

nodes.name: tank
description: A tank is an artificial object that stores a liquid or gaseous portion of matter.

nodes.name: block size
description: Block size is the declared net capacity of a power generating unit.

nodes.name: coking coal
description: Coking coal is hard coal that is bituminous with a quality that allows the production of a coke suitable to support a blast furnace charge. Its gross calorific value is greater than 23 865 kJ/kg (5 700 kcal/kg) on an ash-free but moist basis.

nodes.name: synthetic ammonia
description: Synthetic ammonia is ammonia that has a synthetic origin.

nodes.name: ammonia
description: Ammonia is a portion of matter with the chemical formula NH3. It has a gaseous normal state of matter and can act as an air pollutant. As it can be oxidised it can be used as a fuel.

nodes.name: heat plant
description: A heat plant is an energy transformation unit consisting of heat generating units and a grid component that feeds thermal energy into a heating grid.

nodes.name: fossil waste fuel
description: A fossil waste fuel is a waste fuel that has a fossil origin.

nodes.name: regionalisation
description: Regionalisation is a methodology to calculate spatially distributed energy producers and consumers with the aim to highlight regional differences in energy supply and potentials, particularly related to renewable energies.

nodes.name: compressed natural gas
description: Compressed natural gas (CNG) is natural gas that has been compressed.

nodes.name: power value
description: A power value is a quantity value that has a power unit as unit.

nodes.name: gasoline engine
description: A gasoline engine is an internal combustion engine that uses a gasoline fuel.
editor_note: The term gasoline was chosen as this term is more often used in energy modelling and energy statistics. This is a deliberate deviation from the convention of British English spelling in the OEO.

nodes.name: gas power plant
description: A gas power plant is a power plant that has gas fired power units as parts.

nodes.name: geothermal heat technology
description: A geothermal heat technology is a heat generation technology that describes how to combine geothermal heat units, geothermal heat transfer processes, energy carriers and energy in a specific way.

nodes.name: heat generation technology
description: A heat generation technology is an energy technology that describes how to combine heat generating units, heat generation processes, energy carriers and energy in a specific way.

nodes.name: test data set
description: A test data set is a data set used for testing.

nodes.name: liquid-metal battery
description: A liquid-metal battery is a battery that consists of two molten metal alloys separated by an electrolyte. The rechargeable batteries are used for electric vehicles and potentially also for grid energy storage.

nodes.name: energy transfer function
description: An energy transfer function is a function of an artificial object that has been engineered to transfer energy over a spatial distance.

nodes.name: wave
description: A wave is a water flow that is at the surface of a water body/marine water body/ocean and that is mainly vertically orientated.

nodes.name: heat generation function
description: A heat generation function is an energy transformation function to transform other types of energy to thermal energy.

nodes.name: photovoltaic technology
description: A photovoltaic technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine photovoltaic panels in an electricity generation process with solar energy as input.

nodes.name: solar power technology
description: A solar power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine solar power units in an electricity generation process with solar energy as input.

nodes.name: market premium
description: A market premium is a policy instrument that ensures a guaranteed remuneration, e.g. a fixed feed-in tariff, by paying to the producing agent the difference between a guaranteed return on a good/product and the monetary price for which the good/product is traded on the market

nodes.name: molten-salt battery
description: A molten-salt battery is a battery that uses molten salts as an electrolyte and offers both a high energy density and a high power density.

nodes.name: object aggregate
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: object aggregates may gain and lose parts while remaining numerically identical (one and the same individual) over time. This holds both for aggregates whose membership is determined naturally (the aggregate of cells in your body) and aggregates determined by fiat (a baseball team, a congressional committee).
An entity a is an object aggregate if and only if there is a mutually exhaustive and pairwise disjoint partition of a into objects

nodes.name: electrical heater
description: An electrical heater is a heater that increases the thermal energy using electric energy.

nodes.name: run of river power technology
description: A reservoir hydro storage power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units in run of river power plant and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: zero-dimensional continuant fiat boundary
editor_note: zero dimension continuant fiat boundaries are not spatial points. Considering the example 'the quadripoint where the boundaries of Colorado, Utah, New Mexico, and Arizona meet' : There are many frames in which that point is zooming through many points in space. Whereas, no matter what the frame, the quadripoint is always in the same relation to the boundaries of Colorado, Utah, New Mexico, and Arizona.

nodes.name: renewable energy share
description: A renewable energy share is a process attribute that indicates the fraction of renewable energy related to the total energy of an energy generation or consumption process.

nodes.name: power unit
description: "A unit which is a standard measure power or the rate of doing work." [NIST:NIST]

nodes.name: freight transport
description: Freight transport is a transport process which moves goods from one place to another.

nodes.name: fuel cell electric truck
description: A fuel cell electric truck is a truck that has an electric traction motor and uses electrical energy from a fuel cell and thus is also a fuel cell electric vehicle.

nodes.name: oil power plant
description: A oil power plant is a power plant that has oil power units as parts.

nodes.name: chemical energy storage function
description: A chemical energy storage function is an energy storage function with chemical energy as input and output.

nodes.name: energy storage function
description: An energy storage function is the function of an artificial object that has been engineered to contain energy for later usage whereby input energy and usable output energy are of the same type.

nodes.name: petawatt-hour
description: An energy unit which is equal to 10^15 watt-hours.

nodes.name: electricity generation process
description: An electricity generation process is an energy transformation that has electrical energy as physical output.

nodes.name: mineral oil refinery
description: A mineral oil refinery is an energy transformation unit that applies a mineral oil refining process.

nodes.name: solid biomass power unit
description: A solid biomass power unit is a biomass power unit using solid biomass as fuel.

nodes.name: request
description: A request is a process whereby an agent asks another agent for something or to do something.

nodes.name: battery electric vehicle
description: A battery electric vehicle (BEV) is an electric vehicle that stores energy in a traction battery.

nodes.name: fuel cell electric car
description: A fuel cell electric car is a car that has an electric traction motor and uses electrical energy from a fuel cell and thus is also a fuel cell electric vehicle.

nodes.name: receiver
description: A receiver is an agent who obtains information from a sender.

nodes.name: objective variable
description: An objective variable is a variable that should be maximised or minimised to solve a problem.

nodes.name: plutonium
description: Plutonium is a portion of matter with the chemical formula Pu. It has a solid normal state of matter.

nodes.name: Brent crude
description: Brent crude is a crude oil that is extracted in the North Sea and traded at ICE London.

nodes.name: crude oil
description: Crude oil is a portion of mater of fossil origin comprising a mixture of hydrocarbons and associated impurities, such as sulphur. It exists in the liquid phase under normal surface temperature and pressure and its physical characteristics (density, viscosity, etc.) are highly variable. This category includes field or lease condensate recovered from associated and non-associated gas where it is commingled with the commercial crude oil stream.

nodes.name: exogenous data
description: Exogenous data is a data item whose quantity value is determined outside of a model and is imposed on a model.

nodes.name: air pollution
description: Air pollution occurs when harmful or excessive quantities of substances including gases, particles, and biological molecules are introduced into Earth's atmosphere.

nodes.name: pollution
description: Pollution is an emission with a negative effect on the environment or organisms.

nodes.name: fee
description: A fee is an economic value that represents an amount of money paid for a  particular piece of work or for a particular right or service.

nodes.name: kilojoule
description: An energy unit which is equal to 1,000 joules.

nodes.name: combined heat and power generating unit
description: A combined heat and power generating unit is an energy transformation unit that has both the function to produce thermal energy and the function to produce electrical energy.

nodes.name: ramping
description: Ramping is a process attribute that describes the change in power of an energy transformation unit or an energy converting component per time step.

nodes.name: space requirement for construction
description: A space requirement for construction is space requirement of an artificial object that covers the area needed in order to construct an artificial object.

nodes.name: energy balance calculation method
description: An energy balance calculation method is a methodology to calculate an energy balance.

nodes.name: methodology
description: A methodology is a plan specification that describes processes that are part of a study.

nodes.name: liquefied natural gas
description: Liquefied natural gas (LNG) is natural gas that has a liquid state of matter.

nodes.name: mineral oil refining sector
description: A mineral oil refining sector is an energy transformation sector that covers mineral oil refining.

nodes.name: energy transformation sector
description: An energy transformation sector is a sector that covers energy production, energy transformation from primary to secondary energy and transport of energy to the demand sector.

nodes.name: uncertainty approach
description: An uncertainty approach is a model descriptor that specifies how a model deals with uncertainty.

nodes.name: solid renewable fuel
description: A solid renewable fuel is a renewable fuel that has a solid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: power plant portfolio
description: A power plant portfolio is an information content entity that describes a particular combination or mix of different power plants, e.g. renewables and fossil plants within one business unit or company or trader.

nodes.name: PM10
description: PM10 is particulate matter which passes through a size-selective inlet as defined in the reference method for the sampling and measurement of PM10, EN 12341, with a 50 % efficiency cut-off at 10 µm aerodynamic diameter.

nodes.name: particulate matter
description: Particulate matter is a portion of matter consisting of small particles. It can act as an air pollutant.

nodes.name: chemical energy transfer
description: Chemical energy transfer is an energy transfer of chemical energy.

nodes.name: energy transfer
description: Energy transfer is an energy transformation in form of a spatial transmission, that does not change the types of energies, apart from losses, e.g. waste heat.

nodes.name: energy conversion efficiency
description: Energy conversion efficiency is a process attribute describing the ratio between the input of an energy transformation and the outputs that are used.

nodes.name: marine current energy technology
description: A marine current energy technology is a marine hydro power technology that describes how to combine marine current energy converting units in marine current energy transformations.

nodes.name: mineral oil product
description: A mineral oil product is a fossil combustion fuel produced in a mineral oil refining process.

nodes.name: project
description: A project is a process to achieve a specified goal that is unique in the sum of its conditions like its goal, time and cost budget and its organisation.

nodes.name: provider
description: A provider is an agent that transfers commodities or services to other agents.

nodes.name: electric traction motor
description: An electric traction motor is an electric motor used for propulsion.

nodes.name: electric motor
description: An electric motor is a motor that converts electrical energy into kinetic energy.

nodes.name: oxygen
description: Oxygen is a portion of matter with the chemical formula O2. It has a gaseous normal state of matter.

nodes.name: solar thermal collector
description: A solar thermal collector is a heater that converts solar energy to solar thermal energy.

nodes.name: sectoral emission
description: A sectoral emission is an emission caused by a certain sector.

nodes.name: emission
description: emission is a process releasing by-products from human activity (e.g. production, distribution or consumption) into the environment.

nodes.name: energy storage level
description: An energy storage level is a utilisation value that measures the utilisation/usage/exploitation of energy storage capacity.

nodes.name: utilisation value
description: A utilisation value is a fraction value that describes the instantaneous share of a maximum value that is utilised.

nodes.name: tunnel
description: A tunnel is a transport network component that is built through a certain environment (e.g. a mountain or water) and allows to pass through that environment.

nodes.name: passenger-kilometre
description: Passenger-kilometre is a transport performance unit for the accumulated transport distance of people where one passenger-kilometre equals the transport distance of 1 km for one person.

nodes.name: heating and cooling sector
description: A heating and cooling sector is a sector that covers heating and cooling activities.

nodes.name: industry sector
description: An industry sector is a sector that covers industrial activities with other main purposes of energy transformation.

nodes.name: target description
description: A target description is an information content entity that contains statements about a desired future state of a system that a person or organisation commits to in a legally binding way.

nodes.name: waterway network
description: A waterway network is a transport network that enables transport on water.

nodes.name: lignite power unit
description: A lignite power unit is a coal power unit using lignite as fuel.

nodes.name: coal power unit
description: A coal power unit is a power generating unit using coal as fuel.

nodes.name: temporal resolution
description: Temporal resolution is the resolution of a time series that indicates time-dependent the level of detail.

nodes.name: resolution
description: Resolution is a quality of a dataset that indicates the level of detail of the data.

nodes.name: labour force
description: The labour force is the population of people ages 15 and older who supply labour to the production of goods and services.  It includes people who are currently employed and people who are unemployed but seeking work as well as first-time job-seekers.

nodes.name: gas grid
description: A gas grid is a supply grid that distributes gaseous fuel, e.g. methane.

nodes.name: analysis scope
description: An analysis scope is an information content entity that describes the boundaries of what a study or scenario covers.

nodes.name: energy service demand for ton-kilometre
description: Energy service demand for ton-kilometre is the energy service demand that is consumed to transport one metric ton over a distance of one kilometre.

nodes.name: marine current energy transformation
description: Marine current energy transformation is a hydroelectric energy transformation that converts marine current energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: hydroelectric energy transformation
description: Hydroelectric energy transformation is a hydro energy transformation that converts hydro energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: waste role
description: A waste role is a role of a material entity that has been discarded after primary use.

nodes.name: biomethane
description: Biomethane is a gas mixture produced from biogas by removing carbon dioxide. It consists mainly of methane and can be used as fuel.

nodes.name: renewable energy transformation function
description: A renewable energy function is the energy transformation function to transform renewable energy.

nodes.name: carbon monoxide
description: Carbon monoxide is a portion of matter with the chemical formula CO. It has a gaseous normal state of matter and can act as an air pollutant.

nodes.name: charcoal
description: Charcoal is a portion of matter produced from wood via pyrolysis. It has a solid state of matter and can be used as fuel.

nodes.name: pumped hydro storage power technology
description: A pumped hydro storage power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units in pumped hydro storage power plants and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: final energy carrier
description: A final energy carrier is an energy carrier that has the disposition final energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: bid
description: A bid is a document describing an offer made by an agent to another agent in an effort to exchange commodities or services via terms relating to price and quantity which will be part of the resulting contract.

nodes.name: power plant with electro motive generator
description: A power plant with electromotive generator is a power plant that has an electro motive generator.

nodes.name: biodiesel
description: Biodiesel is a portion of matter that has a liquid state of matter and has a diesel fuel role. It is produced from plants or animals and thus has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: hour
description: "A time unit which is equal to 3600 seconds or 60 minutes." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

nodes.name: output data
description: Output data is endogenous data that is determined by a model calculation and presented as a result.

nodes.name: hydrocarbon
description: Hydrocarbon is a portion of matter which is member of class of organic chemical compounds composed only of the elements carbon (C) and hydrogen (H).

nodes.name: net capacity factor
description: A net capacity factor is a utilisation value that is calculated by dividing the net electricity generation over a given time step by the declared net capacity times the length of this time step.
editor_note: A net capacity factor is typically calculated for a year but other time steps (e.g. month or day) are possible.

nodes.name: port
description: A port is a transport hub for ships.

nodes.name: energy balance data set
description: An energy balance data set is an empirical data set that describes a specified set of energy transformations and a specified set of energy carriers in a spatial region for a specific time step (usually a year).

nodes.name: empirical data set
description: An empirical data set is a dataset that is obtained from observations in the real world.

nodes.name: electricity transshipment model
description: An electricity transshipment model is a model that applies the transshipment problem to the electricity grid.

nodes.name: geothermal heat plant
description: A geothermal heat plant is a heat plant that has geothermal heat units as parts.

nodes.name: blast furnace gas
description: Blast furnace gas is manufactured coal based gas produced during the combustion of coke in blast furnaces in the iron and steel industry. It is recovered and used as a fuel partly within the plant and partly in other steel industry processes or in power stations equipped to burn it. The quantity of fuel should be reported on a gross calorific value basis.

nodes.name: manufactured coal based gas
description: A manufactured coal based gas is a gas mixture that is manufactured from coal. It is used as fossil fuel.

nodes.name: secondary energy production
description: Secondary energy production is the production of secondary energy carriers.

nodes.name: typical year
description: A typical year is a typical period with the duration of one year.

nodes.name: typical period
description: A typical period is a time series that represents a couple of real time periods that have certain characteristics in common, e.g. seasonal specifications, weekly routines, etc. It doesn't refer to a real date. Typical periods are used to reduce computing time of energy system models.

nodes.name: steam-electric process
description: A steam-electric process is an energy transformation that converts thermal energy to electrical energy. A steam turbine and an electro motive generator are participating in a steam-electric process.

nodes.name: emission price
description: An emission price is a monetary price of emitting a certain emission value.

nodes.name: renewable energy carrier disposition
description: A renewable energy carrier disposition is an energy carrier disposition of an material entity that contains renewable energy.

nodes.name: industrial material
description: An industrial material is a portion of matter that is the physical output of an industrial process and that has a good role.

nodes.name: economic stock potential
description: An economic stock potential is a type of stock potential that identifies the proportion of the technological potential that can be utilised economically (based on economic boundary conditions).

nodes.name: stock potential
description: A stock potential is a potential of the stock of a source or sink.

nodes.name: study region
description: A study region is a spatial region that is under investigation and consists entirely of one or more subregions.

nodes.name: synthetic data set
description: A synthetic data set is a dataset that is obtained by artificially creating data items. It is constructed to be an estimation of a real-world dataset.

nodes.name: electricity grid
description: An electricity grid is a supply grid that distributes electrical energy / electricity.

nodes.name: commodity
description: A commodity is a good that bears the commodity role.

nodes.name: good
description: A good is a continuant that has the good role.

nodes.name: scale model
description: A scale model is model comprising of a spatial pattern of components arranged in such a way for them to represent a system.

nodes.name: steam reforming
description: A steam reforming process is a chemical reaction that converts hydrocarbons and steam to syngas. As it converts chemical energy and thermal energy to a different type of chemical energy (and waste heat), it is also an energy transformation process.

nodes.name: written name
description: A textual entity that denotes a particular in reality.

nodes.name: textual entity
description: A textual entity is a part of a manifestation (FRBR sense), a generically dependent continuant whose concretizations are patterns of glyphs intended to be interpreted as words, formulas, etc.
editor_note: AR, (IAO call 2009-09-01): a document as a whole is not typically a textual entity, because it has pictures in it - rather there are parts of it that are textual entities. Examples: The title, paragraph 2 sentence 7, etc.

MC, 2009-09-14 (following IAO call 2009-09-01): textual entities live at the FRBR (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_Requirements_for_Bibliographic_Records) manifestation level. Everything is significant: line break, pdf and html versions of same document are different textual entities.

nodes.name: discount rate
description: A discount rate is an economic value with the unit percent that refers to the interest rate used in discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis to determine the present value of future cash flows.

nodes.name: non-methane volatile organic compound
description: A non-methane volatile organic compound (NMVOC) is a volatile organic compound other than methane.

nodes.name: volatile organic compound
description: A volatile organic compound (VOC) is a portion of matter consisting of organic compounds that is capable of producing photochemical oxidants by reactions with nitrogen oxides in the presence of sunlight. Hence it can act as an air pollutant.

nodes.name: sustainable flow potential
description: A sustainable flow potential is a type of flow potential that takes into account all aspects of sustainability, which usually requires careful consideration and evaluation of different ecological and socio-economic aspects. The differentiation of the sustainable potential is blurred, since ecological aspects may already have been considered for the technological or economic potential, depending on the author.

nodes.name: steam reformer
description: A steam reformer is an energy converting component that produces syngas from hydrocarbons such as natural gas.

nodes.name: electricity sector
description: An electricity sector is a transformation sector that covers electricity generation and transport of electrical energy to consumers of electrical energy.

nodes.name: kinetic energy storage technology
description: An kinetic energy storage technology is an energy storage technology that describes how to combine kinetic energy storage objects and kinetic energy in charging and decharging processes.

nodes.name: gross value added
description: Gross value added is an economic value that is the value of goods and services produced in a sector of an economy, measuring that sector's contribution to gross domestic product (GDP). It is calculated as the monetary value of products and services produced, less the value of intermediate consumption.

nodes.name: transformer
description: A transformer is an electricity grid component that passively transfers electrical energy from one electrical circuit to another.

nodes.name: data format
description: A data format is a data descriptor that specifies the structure in which the data item is encoded.

nodes.name: e-bike
description: An e-bike is a bicycle that is propelled by a person and an electric traction motor.

nodes.name: traction motor
description: A traction motor is a motor that is used for propulsion.

nodes.name: power generation technology
description: A power generation technology is an energy technology that describes how to combine power generating units and energy carriers in a power generation process to generate electrical energy.

nodes.name: compressed gas fuel role
description: A compressed gas fuel role is a fuel role that expresses that a portion of matter can be used in a compressed gas engine.

nodes.name: wood
description: Wood is a biomass from trees. It has a solid state of matter an can be used as fuel.

nodes.name: installation cost
description: Installation and development cost are investment costs incurred for setting up the installation.

nodes.name: investment cost
description: Investment costs are costs of a long-term commitment of financial resources in tangible or intangible assets.

nodes.name: theoretical flow potential
description: A theoretical flow potential is a type of flow potential that identifies the physical upper limit of an input or output of a process in a spatial region of reference per unit time.

nodes.name: international transport
description: International transport is a transport process between different countries or within the same country via another country.

nodes.name: power-to-liquid technology
description: A power-to-liquid technology is an power-to-fuel technology that describes how to combine power-to-liquid systems in power-to-liquid processes.

nodes.name: power-to-fuel technology
description: A power-to-fuel technology is an energy technology that describes how to combine power-to-fuel systems in power-to-fuel processes.

nodes.name: offshore wind power technology
description: An offshore wind power technology is a wind power generation technology that describes how to use wind energy converting units in offshore wind farms.

nodes.name: wind power technology
description: A wind power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine wind energy converting units and a wind energy transformation.

nodes.name: plate heat exchanger
description: A plate heat exchanger is a heat exchanger that uses a plate for a heat transfer process.

nodes.name: bidding zone
description: A bidding zone is a two-dimensional spatial region in which market participants are able to exchange energy without capacity allocation.

nodes.name: switchyard
description: A switchyard is an electricity grid component that connects different levels of voltage

nodes.name: copyright licence
description: A copyright licence is a licence that states the ownership and contractually sets the rights and obligations to use, copy, and distribute a creative work.

nodes.name: licence
description: A licence is an information content entity that contains an official permission or permit to do, use or own something.

nodes.name: export
description: Export is the process of selling goods or services abroad and their delivery to a foreign market.

nodes.name: qualitist
description: A qualitist is an OEP user who mainly interacts with qualitative information.

nodes.name: thorium
description: Thorium is a portion of matter with the chemical formula Th. It has a solid normal state of matter.

nodes.name: sub bituminous coal
description: Sub bituminous coal is coal that is non-agglomerating with a gross calorific value between 17 435 kJ/kg (4 165 kcal/kg) and 23 865 kJ/kg (5 700 kcal/kg) containing more than 31 % volatile matter on a dry mineral matter free basis.

nodes.name: air pollutant
description: An air pollutant is a portion of matter that participates in some air pollution.

nodes.name: areal power density
description: An areal power density is a quantity value that indicates a certain power per area.

nodes.name: fossil diesel fuel
description: Diesel fuel is gas diesel oil used on-road for diesel compression ignition (cars, trucks, etc.), usually of low sulphur content.

nodes.name: industrial process
description: An industrial process is a process that has output object or object aggregates that are economic goods. An industrial process consists of several subprocesses. Examples of subprocesses that can be involved in an industrial process are energy transformations, mechanical operations and chemical reactions.

nodes.name: potential energy storage function
description: A potential energy storage function is an energy storage function with potential energy as input and output.
editor_note: This function was introduce for the sake of completeness, but there is no actual use case seen at the moment.

nodes.name: private transport
description: A private transport is a passenger transport in which people use their own vehicle for movement e.g. bicycle, motorcycle and cars.

nodes.name: passenger transport
description: A passenger transport is a transport process in which people are moved in a vehicle from one place to another.

nodes.name: downhole heat exchanger
description: A downhole heat exchanger is a heat exchanger that transfers ambient thermal energy or geothermal energy to a working fluid. It consists of plastic pipes installed vertically or inclined in a borehole.

nodes.name: compressed synthetic methane
description: Compressed synthetic methane is synthetic methane that has been compressed.

nodes.name: fueled power unit
description: A fueled power unit is a power generating unit that uses fuel.

nodes.name: boolean variable
description: A boolean variable is a variable that represents a boolean value.

nodes.name: power plant operator
description: A power plant operator is an agent that operates an electric utility generation station.

nodes.name: subregion
description: A subregion is a spatial region that is a part of spatial region.

nodes.name: district heating
description: District heating is a grid-bound heating transfer to residential or commercial buildings.

nodes.name: syngas
description: Syngas is a gas mixture consisting primarily of hydrogen, carbon monoxide, and very often carbon dioxide, that can be used as fuel.

nodes.name: pump
description: A pump is an energy converting component that converts energy into kinetic or potential energy of a fluid.

nodes.name: primary energy consumption
description: Primary energy consumption is an energy consumption value accounting for the total consumption of energy in a spatial region excluding the non-energetic use of fuels.
editor_note: Primary energy consumption covers consumption of the energy sector itself, losses during transformation (for example, from oil or gas into electricity) and distribution of energy, and the final consumption by end users. It excludes energy carriers used for non-energy purposes (such as petroleum not used not for combustion but for producing plastics).

nodes.name: power-to-ammonia technology
description: A power-to-ammonia technology is an power-to-gas technology that describes how to combine power-to-ammonia systems in power-to-ammonia processes.

nodes.name: power-to-gas technology
description: A power-to-gas technology is a power-to-fuel technology that describes how to combine power-to-gas systems in power-to-gas processes.

nodes.name: fluid
description: A fluid is a material entity which is a liquid, gas or plasma.

nodes.name: urban population
description: An urban population is a population living in urban areas, as defined by national statistical offices.

nodes.name: energy technology
description: An energy technology is a technology that describes how to combine energy transformation units, energy transformations, energy carriers and energy in a specific way.

nodes.name: delimiter separated file format
description: A delimiter separated file format is a text file format that uses delimiter-separated values (also DSV) to store two-dimensional arrays of data by separating the values in each row with specific delimiter characters.

nodes.name: solid biofuel
description: Solid biomass is a portion of matter consisting of organic, non-fossil material of biological origin which may be used as fuel for heat production or electricity generation.

nodes.name: political party
description: A political party is an organisation of a group of people with common views or goals that wants to have influence in politics.

nodes.name: construction time
description: A construction time is a time span that measures the time that is needed to construct an artificial object.

nodes.name: energy demand
description: Energy demand is a demand for energy.

nodes.name: demand
description: A demand is a realizable entity that is characterised by a person, organisation or object needing it for a specific purpose.

nodes.name: developable stock potential
description: A developable stock potential is a type of stock potential that describes the fraction of the economic potential that can be developed under realistic conditions (regulations, environmental and social restrictions).

nodes.name: binary file format
description: A binary file format is a file format that is not a text format.

nodes.name: model component
description: A model component is a generically dependent continuant that is part of a model.

nodes.name: gross domestic product
description: A gross domestic product is an economic value that represents the broadest measure of aggregate economic activity, measuring the total unduplicated market value of all final goods and services produced within a statistical area in a period.

nodes.name: DOI
description:
A DOI (digital object identifier) is a persistent identifier or handle used to uniquely identify objects, standardized by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).
source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_object_identifier

nodes.name: symbol
description: An information content entity that is a mark(s) or character(s) used as a conventional representation of another entity.
editor_note: 2014-03-31: We would like to have a deeper analysis of 'mark' and 'sign' in the future (see https://github.com/information-artifact-ontology/IAO/issues/154).
20091104, MC: this needs work and will most probably change

nodes.name: software framework
description: A software framework is a Software that is generic and can be adapted to a specific application.

nodes.name: gasoline fuel
description: A gasoline fuel is a combustion fuel that has a gasoline fuel role.
editor_note: The term gasoline was chosen as this term is more often used in energy modelling and energy statistics. This is a deliberate deviation from the convention of British English spelling in the OEO.

nodes.name: marine wave energy power plant
description: A marine wave energy power plant is a power plant that has marine wave energy units as parts.

nodes.name: optimisation model
description: An optimisation model is a model that optimises a target function.

nodes.name: sustainable stock potential
description: A sustainable stock potential is a type of stock potential that takes into account all aspects of sustainability, which usually requires careful consideration and evaluation of different ecological and socio-economic aspects. The differentiation of the sustainable potential is blurred, since ecological aspects may already have been considered for the technological or economic potential, depending on the author.

nodes.name: biogenic industrial waste fuel
description: A biogenic industrial waste fuel is an industrial waste fuel that has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: industrial waste fuel
description: An industrial waste fuel is waste fuel produced by industry.

nodes.name: evaporation
description: Evaporation is a phase transition from a liquid medium to their gaseous state.

nodes.name: phase transition
description: A phase transition is a transformation of a medium from a solid, liquid, or gas state to a different state.

nodes.name: biogenic waste fuel
description: A biogenic waste fuel is a waste fuel that has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: export price
description: An export price is the monetary price for the export of a material entity.

nodes.name: megajoule
description: An energy unit which is equal to 1,000,000 joules.

nodes.name: public transport
description: A public transport is a passenger transport in which a number of passengers share a common vehicle.

nodes.name: nuclear energy carrier disposition
description: A nuclear energy carrier is an energy carrier used in nuclear power stations to produce heat for steam turbines. Heat is created when the nuclear fuel undergoes nuclear fission.

nodes.name: solar tracked receiving surface
description: A solar tracked receiving surface is a solar radiation receiving surface that participates in solar tracking.

nodes.name: pumped water
description: Pumped water is liquid water which was pumped into an upper reservoir and thus contains potential energy.

nodes.name: chemical heat storage object
description: A chemical heat storage object is a thermo-chemical heat storage object that stores thermal energy by using the chemical binding energy in an endotherm reaction.

nodes.name: thermo-chemical heat storage object
description: A thermo-chemical heat storage object (TCS) is a thermal energy storage object that stores thermal energy through reversible exotherm/endotherm chemical reaction with thermo-chemical materials (TCM).

nodes.name: water turbine
description: A water turbine is a turbine converting potential energy and kinetic energy of water into rotational energy.

nodes.name: aerothermal energy
description: Aerothermal energy is a natural ambient thermal energy that is stored in the air of a natural environment.

nodes.name: natural ambient thermal energy
description: Natural ambient thermal energy is ambient thermal energy that has a renewable origin.

nodes.name: geothermal power technology
description: A geothermal power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine geothermal power units in an electricity generation process with geothermal energy as input.

nodes.name: land vehicle
description: A land vehicle is a vehicle that is moved by applying forces against the ground.

nodes.name: reference scenario
description: A reference scenario is a scenario that is used as a reference, e.g. in a scenario comparison. It has the reference role.

nodes.name: creative work licence
description: A creative work licence is a copyright license that determines ownership and permissions for literary work and multimedia work that combines various media types such as text, audio, images, animations, video and interactive content and its collections.

nodes.name: material climate neutrality
description: Material climate neutrality is a disposition of a material entity that conforms to some climate neutrality criterion.

nodes.name: nuclear
description: Nuclear is a conventional origin that indicates that the energy comes originally from nuclear binding energy.

nodes.name: conventional
description: Conventional is an origin of energies that don't replenish when transformed / consumed.

nodes.name: kinetic energy storage object
description: A kinetic energy storage object is an energy storage object that has the function to store kinetic energy.

nodes.name: delivery interval

nodes.name: object
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: To say that b is causally unified means: b is a material entity which is such that its material parts are tied together in such a way that, in environments typical for entities of the type in question,if c, a continuant part of b that is in the interior of b at t, is larger than a certain threshold size (which will be determined differently from case to case, depending on factors such as porosity of external cover) and is moved in space to be at t at a location on the exterior of the spatial region that had been occupied by b at t, then either b’s other parts will be moved in coordinated fashion or b will be damaged (be affected, for example, by breakage or tearing) in the interval between t and t.causal changes in one part of b can have consequences for other parts of b without the mediation of any entity that lies on the exterior of b. Material entities with no proper material parts would satisfy these conditions trivially. Candidate examples of types of causal unity for material entities of more complex sorts are as follows (this is not intended to be an exhaustive list):CU1: Causal unity via physical coveringHere the parts in the interior of the unified entity are combined together causally through a common membrane or other physical covering\. The latter points outwards toward and may serve a protective function in relation to what lies on the exterior of the entity [13, 47
BFO 2 Reference: ‘objects’ are sometimes referred to as ‘grains’ [74

BFO 2 Reference: BFO rests on the presupposition that at multiple micro-, meso- and macroscopic scales reality exhibits certain stable, spatially separated or separable material units, combined or combinable into aggregates of various sorts (for example organisms into what are called ‘populations’). Such units play a central role in almost all domains of natural science from particle physics to cosmology. Many scientific laws govern the units in question, employing general terms (such as ‘molecule’ or ‘planet’) referring to the types and subtypes of units, and also to the types and subtypes of the processes through which such units develop and interact. The division of reality into such natural units is at the heart of biological science, as also is the fact that these units may form higher-level units (as cells form multicellular organisms) and that they may also form aggregates of units, for example as cells form portions of tissue and organs form families, herds, breeds, species, and so on. At the same time, the division of certain portions of reality into engineered units (manufactured artifacts) is the basis of modern industrial technology, which rests on the distributed mass production of engineered parts through division of labor and on their assembly into larger, compound units such as cars and laptops. The division of portions of reality into units is one starting point for the phenomenon of counting.
BFO 2 Reference: an object is a maximal causally unified material entity

BFO 2 Reference: Each object is such that there are entities of which we can assert unproblematically that they lie in its interior, and other entities of which we can assert unproblematically that they lie in its exterior. This may not be so for entities lying at or near the boundary between the interior and exterior. This means that two objects – for example the two cells depicted in Figure 3 – may be such that there are material entities crossing their boundaries which belong determinately to neither cell. Something similar obtains in certain cases of conjoined twins (see below).

This type of battery has a high energy density, high efficiency of charge/discharge and long cycle life, and is fabricated from inexpensive materials. The operating temperatures of 300 to 350 °C and the highly corrosive nature of the sodium polysulphides, primarily make them suitable for stationary energy storage applications. The cell becomes more economical with increasing size.

nodes.name: kerosene
description:
Kerosene, also known as paraffin, lamp oil, and coal oil (an obsolete term), is a portion of matter consisting of combustible hydrocarbon liquid which is derived from petroleum. It is widely used as a fuel in industry as well as households. It is sometimes spelled kerosine in scientific and industrial usage.
[...]

Kerosene is widely used to power jet engines of aircraft (jet fuel) and some rocket engines and is also commonly used as a cooking and lighting fuel and for fire toys such as poi. In parts of Asia, kerosene is sometimes used as fuel for small outboard motors or even motorcycles.

nodes.name: entity
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: In all areas of empirical inquiry we encounter general terms of two sorts. First are general terms which refer to universals or types:animaltuberculosissurgical procedurediseaseSecond, are general terms used to refer to groups of entities which instantiate a given universal but do not correspond to the extension of any subuniversal of that universal because there is nothing intrinsic to the entities in question by virtue of which they – and only they – are counted as belonging to the given group. Examples are: animal purchased by the Emperortuberculosis diagnosed on a Wednesdaysurgical procedure performed on a patient from Stockholmperson identified as candidate for clinical trial #2056-555person who is signatory of Form 656-PPVpainting by Leonardo da VinciSuch terms, which represent what are called ‘specializations’ in [81

Entity doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. For example Werner Ceusters 'portions of reality' include 4 sorts, entities (as BFO construes them), universals, configurations, and relations. It is an open question as to whether entities as construed in BFO will at some point also include these other portions of reality. See, for example, 'How to track absolutely everything' at http://www.referent-tracking.com/_RTU/papers/CeustersICbookRevised.pdf
